I've owned a 4k Tv for almost two years now and prior to owning the Xbox One X I haven't had any devices capable of showing off 4k resolution. I have to say I wasn't expecting much of an upgrade from 1080p HD TV but wow the One X blew me away! The games that are enhanced have never looked better. Even PUBG was given the 4k treatment and it really makes the game stand out. Even if your playing a game that hasn't been visually enhanced for the One X it will still run the game better. We tried WWE 2K18 and those games are known for their long load times and choppy gameplay. Well the load times are still long but the gameplay is freakishly smooth. We can now play 8-man matches with no lag whatsoever! Something I didn't think would ever be possible in that game. That just shows you how much power the One X brings to the table. Navigating the home screens and menus have never been faster and the same goes for watching game clips. Your internet speed can affect this but if your internet is fairly fast, watching a recorded clip is almost instantaneous. No more sitting and waiting 30-60 seconds for the clip to load or finish playing.My one and only complaint with the One X and the reason I docked it a star is the fact that it only comes equipped with a 1 TB hard drive.  1000 gigabytes sounds like a lot of storage but when it comes to the One X nothing could be further from the truth. I own about 56 games altogether and so far I've installed 10 games on the One X and have already used about 57% of the consoles storage capacity. This is extremely irritating since I know it won't be long until I'm forced to buy another external hard drive to make up for the consoles lack of storage. The original Xbox One suffered from this issue as well. From a consumer point of view, its kind of a cheap marketing ploy.Its like they sat down and said lets make an awesome system that looks and performs better, and even though its a requirement to install every game on the hard drive as well as downloading the big 4k updates, let's go ahead and limit the storage. Seriously microsoft? For $500 we should have got 2 TB of storage, at least. How in this day and age of gaming can you put such a tiny hard drive on an otherwise awesome console? Especially when certain games take up so much space. I was shocked when I installed Gears of War 4 and found out it took up 111 GB of space! Yeah 111 gigs, what a joke. That's already 10% of the hard drive right there. I don't care if a game needs a lot of storage to run properly but at least give us the space to make it work! Thats like building a minivan and only putting two seats in it.I honestly don't understand why they don't just offer another version of the Xbox One X with a 2 TB hard drive for $600. They might as well because when I go purchase another external hard drive I'm going to have to pay another $100 anyways; at least it would save me the trouble. Which is exactly what I did with the original Xbox One. So in retrospect I actually spent $600 on the original and new Xbox One totalling $1200. You see my point? Hopefully microsoft will learn from this and fix it for the next console.So other than the storage issue this is a great console. I was on the fence about buying it but I'm glad I did. The performance alone makes up for the small hard drive. A huge benefit if you already own an Xbox One is that you'll be able to play a lot of games together on both consoles that you normally couldn't on one console. If you own a 4k TV I highly recommend picking one up. And if you don't I've heard games still look fantastic on 1080p HDTVs. Do not underestimate the power this Xbox packs. If you can't see the difference you'll definitely feel it.

I have been an xbox player from the beginning and never had so many problems with an xbox.  3 months in and I have already factory reset once, and hard resetting >6 times just so it will start up is the norm.  I am so sad that I purchased this without support as I have never needed it until now.  I have searched all the forums and unfortunately I think my xbox is faulty so I will have to send it in for repairs.Advice, purchase any unlimited service plans and warranties.
Wasted countless hours resetting and trying to fix constant problems with local storage, no signal on HDMI, etc. This is the most frustrating piece of junk I have ever had

Going from an Xbox One Day One Edition with a failing internal hard drive to an Xbox One X is quite a substantial upgrade. Outside of the speed and reliability there isn't much of an interface difference, which I personally enjoy.The packaging was well-kept and simplex, which is something that is highly underrated, in my opinion. Came with all the standards needed to get started; a month of gold, power supply cable, HDMI cable, etc. Out of convenience I am pleased to have an internal power supply. With that said, however, I am slightly uncomfortable with the idea of having another internalized part that is notorious for failing after some time and not having the ability to easily switch it out but hey, I guess Microsoft has to sell new consoles somehow. For example, the Xbox has been built with internal storage since the 360 Slim, and because of this internal storage I was forced to get a new Xbox when my hard drive failed. Unfortunately, getting an external still doesn't protect you from the OS that needs to be ran on the internal drive.I'll update my review when I've had a chance to see how the Xbox One X enhanced games run.

This console was sold as new but was manufactured in 2017 and the warranty had expired before we purchased it in December 2019.  We only learned this when we contacted Microsoft because the product did not work and we provided the serial number to Microsoft.  I consider this a fraud on an unsuspecting buyer.

I have 2 original Xbox One consoles that still work great but this "better" console only lasted a year and a half!?  Video started flickering on and off during play the other day.  I powered it on today and have the dreaded no signal/black screen.  Tried all the YouTube suggestions for hard reset and low-res mode boot, but nothing works.  Warranty expired 5 months ago, which is very disappointing.  Opening a repair with Microsoft for $250 isn't wise, as I bought an Xbox One S last Black Friday for $155 shipped.  I was getting excited to buy the newest version this year, Series X, but this let-down has changed my mind.  I won't purchase Xbox equipment in the future.

If you aren't aware the Xbox One X models have an issue where the HDMI port will suddenly stop working.  Mine is no exception.  I wish I would have known this going into it.  Paying $500 for something that stops working is not worth it.

Believe all the other reviews.  I traded in a fairly new Xbox One S to buy this and it's one of the best purchases I've ever made.  I'm in love.(The S is a great machine in its own right - I don't mean to disparage it at all.  But it's no X.)

Physically, I like the smaller footprint of the console. I often play at my buddy‚Äôs house and this console is a lot easier to manage. As for its other features like higher processing speeds and 4K video, I haven‚Äôt noticed any difference. It could be that I don‚Äôt play any games that require those features. I have a 4K TV, but my games are not. Overall, I don‚Äôt notice a difference between the Xbox One and the Xbox One X. I don‚Äôt regret my decision to upgrade, but unless you have a need for the X‚Äôs ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù, I would hold up on buying one. Again, I have no regrets and I do like the smaller footprint.

Games that used to push my Xbox One to the limit now run like butter. I've yet to encounter a single dropped frame. Even at 1080p the downscaled 4K assets are a breath of fresh air. The console is also whisper-quiet, and stays cool to the touch. Worth getting even if you don't have a 4K TV that supports HDR.It's certainly smaller than the Xbox One - the smaller footprint is much appreciated. The matte black finish means that it doesn't attract fingerprints. Its simple looks mean that it doesn't stand out aesthetically, but it really doesn't have to. It's much more understated than the Xbox One S. Removing the cumbersome power brick is a welcome change.While it was a necessary omission, the lack of a Kinect port does render that peripheral useless without paying an arm and a leg for an unwieldy adapter. I used the Kinect for voice commands fairly often and don't want to resort to buying another piece of equipment just to use them (nor is a headset an ideal option).With the 4K graphical assets you should expect your download sizes to be noticeably larger and will fill up your available storage space quickly. With a 1TB hard drive being the only available option currently, you may end up having to invest in an external hard drive.If you mainly use your console as more of an all-around entertainment machine, the One S may be better suited to your needs and deliver more bang for your buck. It's hard to justify the $499 price tag when the One S is $200 cheaper, but if you're looking for the best possible gaming experience without switching platforms, the One X really is the best way to go.Games Played: Forza Horizon 3, Forza Motorsport 7, Halo 5: Guardians, Destiny 2, Quantum Break, Monster Hunter: World, Assassin's Creed: Origins, Gears of War 4

Great product! If you like Xbox, you‚Äôll love this.I had an experience worth sharing as well: a lightning surge fried my first One X (while it was hooked up to a surge protector). After a phone call or two, I got a replacement for the price of shipping and a week or two wait.Definitely would recommend if you want a gaming console or even just to watch HQ videos. It‚Äôs quiet and powerful.

Probably not a necessary upgrade from a standard XB1, but still a great item to own. Responsive, good update management (you're not installing an update every time you try to use it like other consoles), will allow resume on more than one game, and currently has the best controller on the market.

Reviews said I would get better graphics than my ps4 and it is 4hd. What‚Äôs not to like? Due to poor internet access I have a four hour window to use this machine and Microsoft then demands a update immediately. So the box does what the master says. And I am locked out until it complete. My experience might be better if I was closer to a cell tower but I think not. FYI won‚Äôt play movie discs unless connected to the net. Microsoft needs to know all. Goodwill is going to get a early Christmas presents.

The Xbox had been working well, it was fast, reliable and fun to play. One day I got a startup error, I reset the xbox and nothing worked. I tried the remove everything option, but in a few days, the error popped up again and again. This had happened occurred before 6 months of ownership. I'm disappointed about it's random errors and it cannot be fixed.

It was worth the wait, graphics on a 4K TV is amazing, surround sound and the Dolby free app.....I'm like a kid in Christmas time, Gears of War 4, Halo 5 and Killer Instinct load super fast and plays flawless..A Christmas must have for any true Gamer!!

I was a pc person. I kept hearing good things about Xbox.Please stay with your pc. Xbox is the single worst decision in my financial life.The controller is awful, I hate everything about it. The joy sticks on the controller are terrible. Worst reactionary play ever.Basically I bought a 400 plus dollar DVD player. Going to sell it asap

I was paranoid of ordering this at first as a gift just because of the technical issues people were having with their Xbox and thinking it could be damaged through process and handling since mailmen can throw packages at times. But I am more than satisfied with my purchase. It came in brand spanking new, with Xbox live gold and a game pass. It was well packaged and secured. It came with a remote. It started up perfectly and has been working great since! I recommend to everyone reading my review to give it a chance because every online purchase can have its pros and cons. But this one was definitely all pro! Thank you so much, happy holidays!

Bought this for my husband for Christmas last year.  Around July of this year the player started melting DVD's and games after only playing for about 15-20 minutes. The player would freeze and wouldn't play. I am not a gamer, so I bought this thinking it would play his old xbox games without issue..not that case, you have to pay online fees and download needed software to get the older games to play. None of this was disclosed anywhere "I" could find. Very disappointed in this game console. Guess he will go back to the PS3-4 players. I have reached out to XBox for support and help for refunds and replacement and all I get is ..."I'm sorry, unfortunately, we can't help you, the productivity support time period after purchase has passed."  Seriously...anyone have suggestions...please let me know..

I noticed a significant graphical improvement when playing Fortnite and Black Ops 4. Note that you will only see a large improvement in games that developers made with the Xbox One X in mind (Xbox One X Enhanced titles).In Fortnite the lighting was much better with better shadows and dynamic range. The object pre-load range was extended, frame rate faster, and resolution improved. I'm using a 1440p monitor so not rendering in 4k, but even with a 1080p monitor you will see many advantages to using this console.Black ops 4 has much better texture resolution and graphical fidelity.What I don't like is the fan. The fan is noticeably louder than on the original xbox one, which is expected due to the much higher power consumption of the device. However, the fan is annoying because the fan RPM rapidly changes every second. It's not like your typical PC fan which will ramp up to a speed and slowly ramp down when not needed. I think Microsoft does this to quickly slow or quicken fan speed when desired or not needed but it is annoying.The second thing I don't like is that the built in OS takes up 250 GB of the 1 TB drive. That's not cool!Overall this is a no brainer if you game frequently.

Takes too long to load games, and does too much stuff I really don‚Äôt want, but paid for anyway.  It‚Äôs basically a computer for your TV.  I have a computer, and it‚Äôs a really good one.  If I want to, I can hook my computer up to my TV, so why do I want an XBOX One One X?  I think one of the finest video game consoles ever made were the ones that did one thing well... play games!  Atari 2600, and Playstation, as well as the obligatory NES.  You put in a cartridge, or a CD, and boom!  Games!  I don‚Äôt need parental controls, or some kind of interface for my Netflix account, I don‚Äôt want to surf the web, or set my XBOX to order more cat-food when it senses a specific timbre in my cat‚Äôs meowing.... I just want games, I want them fast, and I want them now!  Updates!  This update will only take 45 minutes!  Would you like XBOX to look up instructions on how to bake something during that time frame so you have something to do while you are waiting to play your games?

I don't understand why there's so much hype 'bout the new Xbox 1X. Aside from all the supposed processing specs, in terms of real life performance the Xbox 360 was 'Way Better'. Playing games on the 1X has been one of the most frustrating experiences ever on a gaming console.  The 1X is too temperamental.  The wireless controller disconnects much too often and requires too much coddling to get it to reconnect. And the problem is not with the controller as I have tried a different new one where the same thing happens. I think the 1X consoles are defective and Microsoft knows it. They need to try to do something to fix this. Looks like I will be buying a PS4 after all.

Order the open boxes item from amazon to save a few bucks... I‚Äôve started to realize that when they say open box it just means the box is slightly damaged.But to the info of the Xbox One X... love it! Makes PUBG and Fortnite load super quick and the graphics are stunning. For PUBG the rendering of the landscape is done before you need to jump. You can even tell that a bush is a bush! No more praying that the one object off in the distance you see isn‚Äôt a guy!

Bought one, stopped working after a couple months. Sent it back to Microsoft to be fixed. They sent it back, still broken. Replaced it on Amazon with a new one. The second one lasted me around a year, and then stopped working as well. Long story short, get a PS4 Pro. Side note: I have a base Xbox One from 2013 and it still works perfectly to this day.

Ordered first console for my son and a month after using it, it died. It would not turn on. So frustrating babease you spend so much money on these consoles that you would think that these companies would have it together. It's just a make as much money as we can from the consumer even though the components are inferior. On the upside, Amazon refunded us immediately and we ordered another console. Hopefully this one isn't a lemon as well.

I bought a new Xbox because i wanted a new Xbox. The box was open and the controller was used and broken. The RB button was stuck down and i had to take apart the controller and fix it. Buy from Microsoft.

I received a defective Xbox. Freezes and crashes after starting 90% of the time. $500 piece of trash. Have tried every hard reboot, power cycling, cache empty, file transfer available. Severely disappointed. Will likely switch to PS4 permanently.

Don't waste your money on the One X. The photo is the current state of mine after Microsoft wouldn't fix the constant crashing and freezing and instead told me to buy a refurbished One X after 18 months. I reformatted it 3 times. Finally had enough and threw it across my basement. Purchased in February 2018.

I am customer outside the US I should have known better  than buying this console from a seller other than Microsoft but I wanted it fast and paid for two day shipping on top of that. I had a controller from since 2016 that I used on the original xbox one and kept the new one from the xbox one x  recently purchased. To my surprise on Christmas Day I tried connecting the new controller with a battery pack it remained connected only for a few seconds, I used lithium double A batteries same result, then I connected a u.s.b cord from the console to the controller and guess what same result, I concluded after being embarrassed in front of my guests that the controller is effectively dead. The console is working fine so far, but this has never happened to me before and I have ordered three consoles from Amazon and never experienced this problem. I will not be buying anything from this seller again.

I've only played 3 games of Fortnite since playing this. Download speeds for games are faster, the graphics (at least in Fortnite) are instantly noticeably better, and it feels really smooth. 10/10 would recommend.

Xbox One X came on time, and thought it worked fine until I tried to play a forza horizon game on it which caused a loss of sound and game crashes making that particular xbox staple unplayable, even after tons of troubleshooting, reinstalls, and factory resets.  But it turns out all nextgen large open world games cause this problem, this is supposed to be the upgraded system. Now I can't progress in red dead redemption 2, really wish I had discovered this console was defected during the return period.

Wow. wooowwww. The moment you pick it up it becomes clear this is a quality product. Just the shear weight alone you know the hardware inside is as rock solid as its exterior. Insane specs that are instantly clear transitioning from the original xbox one.I made the change, because I game enough it was worth it. 1 TB of memory +2 TB external storage. I practically never need to worry about memory for a while.The screen transitions are so smooth, games like The Division, Ghost Recon, R6 Siege, Battlefield, Gears of War. They all look incredible.I went from 720p with my TV and Xbox One to 4K with a Samsung TV and The X1X and just wow. PS4 people can pretend they have the better hardware but this is literally the best spec-ed console. Outperforms the PC I built for almost 2.2k.Night and Day.

I couldn't pass up buying an XBO-X with $100 and another $111 trade-in on my OG Xbox One. $300 was a no brainer. The new X has a better controller out of the box (textured vs smooth plastic so it's more grippy). I am playing on a very high-end 1080p plasma set and the graphical increases are noticeable on the enhanced games already in my library. Even though it doesn't let me select 10-bit or 12-bit output for some reason, the colors are still great with the full rbg option on 8-bit.I've tested with Rise of the Tomb Raider, AC: Origins, and The Division thus far. All look great and have that extra level of sharpness/smoothness (due to supersample, AA, & AF), more detailed textures, and better shadows than the OG xbox one. For $300 I think it was a steal. Load times are also better even if marginally.The ONLY regret I have is not having the kinect for voice commands anymore. It was so convenient to say Xbox On/off, Xbox Mute, etc... and not have to power up a controller or walk over and grab a remote for the TV. I hope that feature gets baked into the next generation. It one of those things you don't know you'll miss until it's gone.EDIT: Amazon Trade-In program basically did a bait and switch by rejecting my Day 1 Xbox One trade. I sent it in  packed in the original box and they said it was rejected because the "power cord didn't work."  Bullsh*t... It ran perfectly before I shipped it to them and guess what... It ran perfectly when I got it back. Scammed me to think I had $111 credit and turned around and billed me for that amount.DO NOT USE AMAZON TRADE-IN. YOU'VE BEEN WARNED.

What can I say about this this is pure magic I own the first edition Xbox One and I didn't buy the Xbox One S or anything like that I was hoping that something like this would come out I made the switch from the Xbox One to the Xbox One X and could tell the difference when playing Assassin's Creed origins or any other enhance Xbox game especially on a 4K UHD TV I would advise everyone to upgrade to this it is just amazing the biggest issue I had was setting my TV to True UHD so that the 4K would enable on the Xbox which I just did a simple Google search and took me 2 minutes

mixed reactions.the 'home' page is cluttered compared to PS3.'home' page is not really 'home'.it's more like 'tent city',cluttered with apps and ads that come and go.the 'edge' browser disappeared the other day.I miss the old PS3 'x bar'.now that was 'home'.bought the 'media remote',but couldn't find the battery cover.there isn't any that you can easily see.there is a microscopic black 'arrow',nearly invisible on the black case - voila.and the buttons are 'low profile',vanishingly low, hard to feel or locate without looking.I missed some Xbox fine print.where it says this 'free' gamewill cost you $9.99 per month,you have to join Gold something.(I flunked 'reading fine print' in school)

I'm not a sonyboy but this system cannot be compared to PS4 Pro in regard of smoothness and responsiveness. The main menu is slow and complicated. Microsoft always makes glitchy operating systems no matter what. Watching 4k movies is a big hassle. During 2 different movies the system froze at least 5 times without any way to get around the glitch unless you hard reboot it. My suggestion to you - if you had previously been playing PS4 or its Pro version, then you are gonna hate this system and return it back.

Shipped quickly. Arrived in good working condition. Has seen a average of 20 to 50 hours of use per week for the last 3 months without any problem. With and without a 4k television the upgraded graphics and preformance are noticable. I wasnt sure if I was going to get more for my money, but after focusing on xbox one enhanced/4k games and streaming services I am very satisfied with my purchase. If you are a xbox owner considering the upgrade, and youre committed to the console for the forseable future, buy. PUBG, Monster Hunter World, Netflix, and many other enhanced features/ titles are much more enjoyable in contrast to their standard xbox one versions.

The controller is awful because it loses connection if you are more than 3 feet away! They say it's because of my wireless router BUT WHY DOES MY OLD "DAY ONE 2013" XBOX ONE CONTROLLER WORK FLAWLESSLY AND WHY DOES THE ROUTER INTERFERE?! ROUTERS ARE EVERYWHERE NOW! But besides that it is still a xbone nothing great to really say. Better graphics and seems to be smoother game play but for the price I'm disappointed. Playstation still has a more solid system. I bought this because the optical drive in my old xbox one went bad just like with my really old xbox 360. Never had to do that with my playstations! PRAISE SONY!OH but the 1 good thing is that you can transfer game data from external drives to the internal drive with no issues and it's very easy to figure out so at least there is that.

Nice game console. Purchased used but looks new. Everything was included and works perfectly. Warehouse deals have been consistently good and I have been buying many items used. I did need to update the xbox and controller. It is possible the person that previously purchased it didn't know that the controller needed to be updated before it could be used ( plugged in by USB, updated, then connected to Bluetooth). It has been used almost daily and is working perfectly.

I've been an Xbox user since day 1.  This Xbox to me represents a massive improvement over the S.  Increased speed in loading is definitely noticeable.  The higher resolution and HDR on compatible TV's is RIDICULOUS.  Get ready for gaming that blurs the lines on VR without a VR headset.Playing the new Forza with the lights off and looking through a windshield doing 100+mph in the rain never looked so good...so real.Another thing I noticed right away is that it is whisper quiet.  I mean, like you can't hear this thing doing anything...I don't think I've even heard a fan yet.My only knock, is the 1TB drive will get eaten up real fast with these dang games and game updates...seems like they could have gone 2TB.Lastly, make sure you have some fast internet.  The updates to the console and 4K games are immense.

The Xbox One X really just looks nice. I love the matte black finish and modern design. As for performance, it's the most you can get out of a console right now and makes for the perfect all in one media center. It will have all the apps you need, play all of the DVDs/Blurays/4kBlurays you like, and give you a nice gaming experience with a solid game library. Not as good of a selection as Steam on PC, but it's still plentiful with a few great exclusives such as Red Dead Redemption 2.I gave it 4 stars due to poor quality control. My Xbox One X was fully functional but had a defective fan. It was oddly loud at idle, producing a grinding sound that I could hear from across the room. Definitely a bad fan. I question the longevity of an Xbox One X and the quality of the fan. I would hope they would use a quality, reliable fan in something that couldn't function without it. That said, if your even a little tech savvy the Xbox One X is super easy to disassemble and work on. The fan would be simple to source and replace.

I ordered this for my fiance to replace his Xbox One. He absolutely loves the One X. I like it too for watching movies. Blu rays look way better even on our non-4K TV, however I'm looking forward to getting a 4K TV now that we have the Xbox One X. As far as gaming quality he says that he hasn't come across any issues and the new COD looks really cool and doesn't lag. It costs a lot, but I think overall it is worth it since we will be using it for a long time.
Couldn't even run Halo: Master Chief Collection without crashing and requiring a complete system reset. Guaranteed scam Xbox, most likely containing Chinese internals.

The system is impressive when it works... I've had the xbox less than a month and have problems. I'm not sure if it is my controller or the system but even though the light on the controller stays on it frequently disconnects. I've tried following the different helps I could find and nothing has worked so far... Everything, including the controller, have the most recent updates. Needless to say this is ridiculous for a system I've had less than a month.

Update: ok apparently it‚Äôs not just my case. There are multiple cases complaining about it. Check your warranty once you received it!It‚Äôs a gift for my friend so when he opened it for the first time, it has passed the 1-month replace time form amazon.The problem is, when he tries to open it second time, it doesn‚Äôt work. There is no output from the Xbox.Ok COOL. So we tries to ask for help from Microsoft. The funny thing is, the warranty has expired! And we find a label on the back of machine saying that ‚Äòservice date 2018-04-05‚Äô which might confirm that it is a refurbished machine!Holly cow, I paid for a new machine instead of a refurbished machine with defect! They(amazon or Microsoft or both) are deceiving their customer!Guys, take my word, no matter if it function well or not, check your warranty period on the Microsoft website once you receive it, if, you have to buy from there.

I had purchased a One S when it first came out and wanted the One X when that came out cause of its high specs, finally bough it on black Friday for $399 and am totally happy with my purchase! I noticed a significantly higher difference in graphics between the two machines while playing Red Dead Redemption 2, love this one x so much! Still kept my one s, just moved it out to my loving room. Awesome machine, very powerful!

I REALLY like this XBOX. It is leaps and bounds ahead of my old XBOX 1. It's getting three stars because of the chincy, cheesy power cord that came with it. When you spend this amount of money on an item such as this you would expect the peripherals to be high quality as well. The power cord is so cheaply made that it just falls out of the plug on the machine. Fortunately I had a spare that plugged right in. When you inspect something like this and one of the most obvious components fails, it makes you wonder what else is wrong with it. When I drop a huge amount of change on something I expect a quality product. Obviously someone was sleeping at the quality control department.

This thing is a monster. I load in astronomically faster to games and lobbies than any of my friends, and I can noticeably tell the difference in how well games run on this console. It is a must have for the console gamer trying to increase performance and increase satisfactory gameplay!

Ultra disappointed in the Xbox one X.  Unit will lock up every 30 seconds to a minute.  Most games will not even open.  Every few minutes the unit will shut down due to overheat errors even though the console is in open air and well ventilated.  I have sent this unit back to Microsoft and they send it back claiming the unit is fine and all the diagnostic tests they run check out fine.  I ended up buying a normal Xbox one (Not the X) and it works just fine.  Never had it lock up once.

Very nice console and the X Box One X enhanced games on a 4k TV really look as good as anything I've ever seen.  This box has plenty of storage and loads faster than other consoles, although the new games are big and take a good while to load (Star Wars Battlefront II for example).  Forza looks amazing on this console BTW!I've unhooked and took this on a family trip over the holidays and now back home.  It works perfect and the whole family, young and old, thoroughly enjoyed this version of Xbox!  Weighs more than I thought it would but feels very solid.  Can get pretty warm out the back of this unit.I highly recommend unless you are worried about leaving very old games behind.  For that, go on MS website and check for compatibility first.  I've ran into a few old games that will not play on this unit.The blu ray and 4k drivers also work great and we've enjoyed watching very high 4k resolution movies.
I‚Äôm beyond happy I received the product on time and I loved it. That image is 4K and I love it . Worth the investment

Played with the regular XBox One S for a while and I thought that since the X runs in 4K, that the actual performance would be the same or even slower.  But no, it's actually faster in all respects, and is in 4K.  The first XBox One X I got had very bad coil whine.  If yours does, exchange it!  My new one has a very quiet fan sound but nothing like the whirrr it used to have.

If you have the extra cash than buy it. I have a 1500$ PC and it can run some games at 4k, all games at 1080 ultra. The reason this console can do it with ease it because its had a lot more optimization. All my windows games and Xbox games run at 4k with ease. IDK how they did it but they did, and for just 495$ For 495 you won't find a 4k machine.

The graphics on the Xbox One X Enhanced are phenomenal, and smooth. Gameplay is also smooth even with the most demanding of the newest games out there. I love this console.  The only thing that would make it better right out of the box would be to have an SSD and Bus that supports faster data transfer rates, instead of a standard hard drive. Installing a game onto the hard drive is slow and painful, and game loading can be painful as well.  Better data transfer rates would have made both of these more bearable.  My workaround is to launch a game, and then I go get a drink and snack.  By the time I get back, the game is ready to play, and so am I.

We bought this in April 2020 (for $323 it's now much more). It's having problems where it turns off randomly.  We went to our Microsoft account to try to get it serviced. To find that the warranty expired in October 2019 - 6 months before we bought it! That's crazy.  I bought it new, I expected it to come with a normal warranty.  It worked fine until this past week. The seller doesn't control the quality of the hardware, it's not their fault it's having this glitch. The seller does control selling it with an already expired warranty.

Worked fine for a week. Then it won't turn on. Do not buy, I know its cheaper than other versions but that's because it's an old faulty version of the console, or it's used. Going to return and get an Xbox directly from Microsoft, at least then they will fix it for me.

Got this for $374 using Prime. A big upgrade compared to the Xbox One S model. Works great with my Vizio 4k 50" with HDR and 120hz refresh. Games start up faster, load times are shorter (internet-300mbps dl speed). Movies (DVD, Blu-Ray, 4K UHD) and streaming look great.Still the same complaint as always with Xboxs... no built in rechargeable batteries. Come on Microsoft, get your head out of the clouds, and upgrade the controllers!

Set everything up and was working fine for a few days. Then out of nowhere it would connect to the internet even tho it was hard wired in. Woildnt let me sign in my account and kept freezing when I tried to start a game.  Had to factory reboot twice. Returned to amazon and got a new one from eb games.

This item has not worked properly since I purchased it. It continuously freezes on every single game. I have done a factory reset several times erased all of my content and replaced at all. Getting a hold of Xbox is a worthless endeavor I would not buy this unit it has several problems. Check around on the Internet and you will see several people having the same issues.

Always been a xbox fan. I owned the xbox one s and sold it for an upgrade to this the xbox one x. The xbox one x is fantastic in every category. The graphics are unbelievable and even if they dont have as many exclusives as playstation, they at least have the exclusives i want (state of decay 2, halo, forza, gears of war 4). I bought a ps4 pro and just didnt like it as much as xbox, oh and the fact it is noticeably different. The superior graphics of the xbox and the speed of loading and downloading. I also used to leave my ps4 on for hours and it would get hot as hell. I can leave my xbox one X on all day long and the temperature will stay cool. Xbox one x 10/10 Ps4 pro 7.5/10
I bought this just for Red Dead 2.  No regrets

This thing is great. The design and compactness of it is second to none, and it really does make games look better, even on my 1080p. I used to play final fantasy xv and Witcher 3 on the OG XB1, and playing it on the One X i see a noticeable graphical difference, especially with lighting and textures. I even brought the games over to my friends house who still games on the fat xb1 to confirm it. I can only imagine what this thing can do on a fully compatible 4k tv (like the Samsung QLEDs). If you are an xbox guy and a graphics person, this is a must buy (unless you already own a slim, then i would give it a little more thought). If you have the fat xbox, you will NOT regret upgrading to this.

After getting my PS4 account hacked into from identity theft,,,, Sony basically shut me down and I lost everything. They wanted me to pay for all the worthless junk someone ordered or lose my account. All my games I bought, my year of Plus, all gone. I already had an Xbox One, but I bought this X and I love it. I didnt realize how much better it was on my 4K TV than my xbone and PS4 pro was. As far as im concerned, it beats my PS4 pro in every aspect. Games look better, the console itself is easier to operate, the controllers feel better, whats not to love?

So I bought it June 30, got here on the first of July or somewhere around there. Worked perfectly until it started uninstalling and installing things on its own. It got to a point where games wouldn‚Äôt function or load, so I did a hard reset. It would not fire back up. After loading the troubleshooter (where you hold the sync and eject button simultaneously) I tried an offline update (where you download the update on a usb from a computer and use that for the Xbox to properly update) and it just shut off. Returned  yesterday and will get my money back soon hopefully. It‚Äôs like a hit or miss buying this product, sometimes they work and sometimes they don‚Äôt. If you decide to buy this, make sure yours works for a solid month and a half and if you notice anything bad or weird (uninstallations, weird noises, slowness, jumpy graphics, slow start up time, etc. ) return it immediately for a replacement. You only have 30 days, I was lucky that there customer service allowed me to return it. Very much a bunch of bogus, I guess I‚Äôll be happier once I‚Äôm refunded. But use caution - don‚Äôt be surprised if your console begins to act funny because it just might. Everyone (including me) says ‚Äúno way it‚Äôll happen to me!‚Äù And it did, so just be cautious. Hoped this helped

The XBOX ONE X. I don't normally write reviews, however this addition to my home theater deserves propper credence.  I made the transition from my origanal xbox one to the one x and the increase in performance is totally worth the money.  I transfered the original xbox data to the new xbox one x by connecting both units to my network and signing into my account on the new unit ( check youtube for procedure). This took quite a while,  I set both units to not go into standby and let it go.  Down to the "grit". The improvement from 1080p to 4k HDR ( samsung 4k display ) is pure EYE CANDY! The draw distance is greatly increased. Meaning the clarity at 75 yards around you is super sharp and the clarity 1/2 mile away in now very sharp ( RED DEAD REDEMPTION 2 ).  The frame rate in gameplay has also been boosted. Load times have been decreased and are noticeable.  I don't seem to have a difference in digital sound performance but I am not running dolby atmos on my Denon receiver yet, so I can't attest to  that.  So, if you are moving towards making the jump in the direction of enhancing your gaming experience.  The investment in a XBOX ONE X is a "TRI AWESOME" deal. Not to mention you can play 4K bluray media on this rig as well.

Microsoft website and Xbox instructions say the Xbox One X should not be plugged into a surge protector because it has an internal built in surge protector but when there is a surge after the warranty expires, there is no separate guarantee for the surge protector itself.  Had a surge today and everything that was plugged into the surge protector is fine, but the Xbox that was plugged into the same outlet is fried.  How can they tell you to not plug the Xbox into a surge protector but offer no surge protection once the Xbox warranty expires???? I think I will report this to the better business bureau as well as post on facebook and maybe even right a letter to Microsoft.

I ordered a used like new Xbox one X but I got a brand new one! Came in original box, box was opened and a little rough on the edges, but console and controller were in the original packaging, they work perfectly fine and don't even have a scratch on them. The package seems like someone opened it just to get the free month of gold but I don't care about that, I paid for a used console and got a brand new one!

I purchased this for my husband while he was away 7 months ago, he got to use it about 10x since then with work trips and spending time with our family... it randomly would not work and now it just doesn‚Äôt work so I came to look at the listing and it says discontinued... just a little shady

A year and a half into ownership of the most expensive console - the HDMI port is dead and frequently overheats while sitting on top of my desk with perfect airflow. The console is on a quality surge protector. I think quality control at foxcon is garbage. I now have to shell out 250 dollars to get the console replaced or repaired. 400 dollar consoles should not die after a year and a half of light use.

I really wish I could rate this product 0 stars.Console worked grate for just a couple weeks slowly but surely I started having issues. From my controller never able to stay connected to constantly being disconnected when I play games.  I soonlearned after taking it to a Microsoft store that the console had the wrong graphics card wrong network ship and lan chip. That explained why I could never play games and when I tried it cut off and in order to connect again I had to do a factory reset on this console. The price of switching theses items out is close to the price of the console itself. As a lot of the components are designed for those pieces so they need to be replaced to. I couple of my friends who have also got this product recently have encountered the same issue with the same result as Iv had. Upon some research itself Iv learned a lot of theses consoles are faulty. The only way I can watch videos is if I‚Äôm wired. If I try to use WiFi my console can‚Äôt handle it and shuts off.
Like too many others mine was DOA. The bright side of the experience is that returning it was painless - UPS came to the house and picked it up and Amazon issued me a credit within 5 days.

I ordered the Xbox One x from Amazon next day it came the next day. Packing was good. Box was unharmed. And using the x box, one x compared to the issues I was having with the original Xbox One. All all the issues went away. Frame rate went smooth. The graphics were noticeably better. In the game stopped freezing up. I have nothing but good to say about this new system. I also purchased a 2 terabyte external hard drive. So I could transfer my data between systems. Load times are noticeably quicker. Just a fantastic system. Thank you, Microsoft. And you to Amazon?

Xbox is an Xbox. Be very weary of who you buy it from.  Mine was supposed to be new and came with contents spilled into a box that's too big with teo small pieces of foam and paper with all the contents of the original box spilled inside. You can see spots in it where during shipping the console smashed side to side potentially damaging it.  I decided not to trust it and to return it without testing.  Totally unacceptable.  Be wary of Neobahamutz as seller.

After a few days of use I noticed the controller that came with it would disconnect from the Xbox.  I swapped out battery packs and even switched to alkaline batteries but it would still disconnect.  The controller didn't actually power off but I wouldn't get any response until I pulled the battery out of it and then put it back in.  If you use a cable and plug it in it works fine.At the time I was heavy into whatever I was playing so I grabbed a controller from the other Xbox and synced it and had no issues.  I continued using one of my other controllers and unfortunately for me it slipped my mind until last week when I remembered and switched back to the included controller and same thing - works fine wired but wirelessly it will disconnect.  I checked the firmware on it using Microsoft's directions and it's up to date.  So I checked the warranty and unbelievably Microsoft shows it's out of warranty?  I get that this is old stock but it's still a brand new system???  So now i'm out a controller unless I fork over 50 bucks for a new one to replace a brand new one.

Fantastic upgrade from a ‚ÄúDay One‚Äù edition XBone.  Some reviews made me nervous where they claim that theirs was previously open.  In my case the worries were unfounded.  The 4K looks great obviously but the rock solid frame rate is where this continues to shine.  No more slow-downs when there‚Äôs a lot going on on the screen.  Load times are faster but not significantly changed for me.

This is an absolutely amazing console. It has such a minimalistic and sleek design, and just looking at this beauty is enough to please one‚Äôs eyes. I read many reviews of people who claimed to receive defective units, and I did fear that I would receive one as well, but mine was and still is in perfect condition. Performance-wise, it is absolutely stellar and is pretty much comparable to a gaming PC. This console is able to display impressive graphics while maintaining a very high frame rate. To top things off, this console stays completely quiet, the user would have to be in a completely mute room to hear this console at all. I love it and this is a must-buy for any gamer.

I‚Äôm so happy with my purchase, I use it as my makeshift entertainment center. I use the blue ray player the rare times I have a dvd to watch. I use the YouTube app to watch 4k videos. Half  of the games I own are 4k so it‚Äôs absolutely a blast to play games in 4k resolution. The system has given me no problems and have been so fun owning. I chose the xbox 1x over a ps4 because I just prefer xbox ecosystem and the draw of 4k gaming and a blue ray player made me choose it over the competition. If you choose the xbox 1x to get the best experience I would recommended using it with a 4k tv. This is my first xbox 1 system so I‚Äôm happy I waited and didn‚Äôt get thto previous systems.

Only a couple of minor complaints that resulted in a reduction of a Star. First con was the  gash/scratch underneath the console (which does not bother me any because nobody can see underneath the xbox one x). Secondly, there was no cable for the controller. This was easily remedied since i own 2 controllers/cables & 3 rechargeable batteries already for my pc. Everything else looks to be stable. So far it seems to be a good buy, thank you.

I was planning to go from Xbox one to the S, but I had such a hard time I decided to spend the extra money for the X. So good so far. Sucks last gen games sometimes freeze when playing on the X but that is probably a developer issue not the console itself. Looks way better with a 4K tv.Update: system works fine most of the time, but I get random freezing and crashing which powers off the system. Nice now that it‚Äôs too late to do anything about it.

So far it‚Äôs functioningI was very disappointed in the shipping process.Whoever shipped it couldn‚Äôt care less if it got to me in working orderWhen I received it the first thing I noticed was no fragile stickers on the box and the box was crushed, then upon opening the box the Xbox was in holy plastic and had very little padding to provide additional protection from the transfer processIf the shipper or seller would have showed more care this would have been a great deal at $289.00So far it is working as it should I‚Äôm very happy it has a built in 4K ultra HD blu ray player because that was really the deciding factor should I buy a Ultra 4K blu ray player for $250 or add $39 and score a gaming system too.Like I said so far so goodOnly time will tell.Ok this is a continuation from the previous comment and it‚Äôs been a minute since I plugged her in and so far so good, disc drive is fine, hard drive is fine & WiFi connection is supreme!!So for the finale comment......Packaging was SuperSubPar otherwise Golden !!!!

Does not play Skyrim 360. Said it was backyards compatible.Does not copy games via USB.  Have to sign up for Xbox gold.The free trial in the box had expired.Requires internet just to start, and downloaded 4 GB of updates.I just bought this because the hard drive in the 360 went out.  Thought it would load faster.  But with the network requirements (no home network) and the fact I can't play my 360 games on it, I am giving it a shot of 1.This is not an upgrade to an existing system, it is not backwards compatible and requires a home network to even start.

I can't handle the power. My cat tries to sleep on the console and is suddenly awaken from the sheer magnitude of this console. Bought a new 55 inch 4k television to go with it, and it's visually stunning. Games play smoother, older games have a solid resolution upgrade. Framerates are improved also. It has become the alpha in our household and we fold to it's every need and desire. FEEL THE POWER!

The look and performance of the console so far has been excellent.The game selection is great.Backward compatibility and a 4K bluray player were major pluses that truly set this console apart from my PS4.Overall this was a very worthwhile upgrade.
Awesome console that arrived in two days. A joy to play new and old xbox games with enhanced graphics. If you have to pick just one console you will not be disappointed with the One X baby!
From playing games to watching movies this console does it all . even without a 4k tv this console makes a huge difference

Got this to replaced a day one xbox, enjoy the form factor and quality of this xbox. Would recommend for those looking to upgrade once it comes down in price as Scarlett comes out. Games play better and load better versus my old xbox, otherwise the experience is the same.

Amazing performance for a game platform. 4kUHD is seamless, game loading times are virtually gone. My son and I were both stunned (and continue to be). Well worth the money. He sold all his older xbox stuff. Glad we got it.

I have the PS4,Nintendo Switch and the Xbox One X. The Xbox one X is my favorite by far. With a 4K UHD tv this system looks amazing. It‚Äôs a bit pricey but worth it if you plan on using it a lot for steaming and gaming.

Brand new in the original packaging, so it works as expected. Runs a lot smoother than my one S. I recieved a message from the seller asking if I have used it and if I was satisfied, so I figured I would let them know with this review because I have no idea how to respond to their message. The one X is great and runs my games a lot better than I am used to. I used the xbox live gold trial to set my dad up an account on my old xbox and we have enjoyed playing games together since I got it. :)

After a month I had error codes was finna return I was like 4 weeks in with two days left to place my refund but got usb hard drive did what they said and it rebooted my game system then later after my return period was up error codes came back and the hard drive wouldn‚Äôt even fix it and it‚Äôs hard to get someone on the phone to help you wit issue of fixing it step by step so 2 months later no Xbox don‚Äôt bow how to cancel membership finna get another one however but not thru here... I say that to say this... Shop somewhere else!!!!!!!

Was hesitant to purchase because it said discontinued and some reviews said it‚Äôs used. Box came BRAND NEW and sealed with all the codes. Been using it for a almost a month and no errors whatsoever. So far I‚Äôm very very happy üëç

My son loves this console upgrade especially coupled with the 4K television he bought. Package came significantly knackered with only one 3-bubble pillow. Xbox package itself had a crease across the middle (something heavy must‚Äôve been on top) and most worrisome were both wafer seals were broken! Console seems to be fine one day after Christmas and seller offered to extend protection to end of year.

how did my day 1 launch date xbox last longer then my 1 year 3 month old xbox one x console? Well ill tell you because microsoft builds inferior products now. I had 1 original xbox and xbox 360 with 1 controller and headset for both. Lasted me the entire lifetime of the console, many, many years. Now flash forward to xbox one and i have gone through 4 headsets and 5 controllers and down one xbox one system that has been in use for 1 year 3 months. Trying to go through microsoft support is ALWAYS a nightmare. About fed up with xbox and probably will just give up on the company and products.

Last year I bought an Xbox One X. A couple weeks ago I started experienced an error where I would be booted from live/wireless network after an avg of 20 minutes. Weird I know that detail right? I was in stuck a loop of customer service for a week, and know for a fact because I was asked this same question 10 times. I was thrown around to new reps, forced to tell the same stories. Then when I finally reached someone that had answers I was told I was just barely past warranty, it was a faulty Xbox, and would cost me near price of goods to "get it looked at". Cannot even stream movies reliably on my Xbox. I am burnt, will not be purchasing another Xbox. I will not rearrange my apartment for my Xbox, owned by PS4 for 6 yrs no problems. That is cheap customer service.

Great console but must have a cheap network card.  Havent seen a review about this yet but it happened to numerous people on forums.  Beware buyers who plan on playing over Wifi. Terrible lag spikes every 3-5 minutes shooting from 0-10 ping to 300-800 and it ruins the game.  I have an OG xbox one in the same exact spot and it has no problems on my wifi.Theory:Microsoft made a very speedy and powerful console, but implemented a cheap or defective network card.  As shown on forums, their support seems to dodge true answers as they repeat solutions that have clearly not worked for their clients.  Microsoft must be keeping this under wraps.  Only solution for the users was to hardwire or simply return.

The product works great, and this Xbox is a phenomenal model. Just be careful with buying used Xboxes. This was advertised as a complete package from the Amazon fulfillment and it came with just the Xbox and power cord. Customer service wanted to refund me after a return, but I had already gifted it. They had no interest in compensating me for misadvertising otherwise.

Only gets one star because it won‚Äôt let me give none .Bought this as a birthday present for son . It was delivered very quickly. Son opened only to find out it did not work . The unit kept turning off and was not able to do anything. He was Very disappointed and I had to go out and buy a another one from local store . Now have to ship this one back and wait 10 days or so for the money back . Guess the old saying is true , you get what you pay for .

I wish I had never purchased this console. We bought this for our grandchild‚Äôs birthday.  You would think for $600 for the console and $50 a game we could insert the game, hit okay, and enjoy it. Wrong. Three weeks later, after entering emails, setting up Microsoft accounts, going through help videos, and countless other things, it is nothing but an expensive mistake. We don‚Äôt want to play online, we don‚Äôt want online games, we don‚Äôt want to play in groups, we don‚Äôt want to play with other friends, we just wanted to insert the game and enjoy playing with our grandchild. We should have ourchased a Nintendo Switch for a lot less money and frustration.
Beware its faulty AS SEEN IN OTHER REVIEWS, mine system would not turn if you want a used system and don't mind it sitting and not working for six hundred dollars that's ok.

over hyped as the most powerful system on the market.. i purchased expecting the most powerful system on the market and it did less than deliver. i could tell little or no difference in my current Xbox one: master chief edition and the new Xbox one x that is reportedly more powerful..  this system did boost the graphics BUT i also purchased a new high end gaming monitor at the same time.  so the graphics boost may or may not be due to the new console..  i would not recommend upgrading to this console..
Was skeptical before purchasing, glad i did!Graphics and performance are great, new style dashboard took some time to get used to.

This Xbox kept refusing to save my progress and I had to keep deleting my player game data and re-download it multiple times during each session. It was too much for me to wait 45 minutes each time and my game data was messed up. The return shipping was over 30.00, so I'm still out for something that was supposed to be PRIME.

PROS-- best controllers-- amazing hardware enable amazing games-- huge game library-- best multiplayer networkCONS-- controller loses connection frequently, interrupting gameplay-- removed the feature to watch movies with friends remotely
Love it...this is the best console on the market right now! This console not only increases your graphics but it also stops the screen tearing in a lot of games.

Bought to play 4k games and TV.  Works well after getting 4k settings tuned to my receiver and projector setup.  Can take some time to get this correctly setup.  Loads games faster than Xbox One S with excellent 4k picture quality.  Worth the upgrade when paired with a 4k display.

This System is better then the past XBox's before it with slower CPU's.  A fair System if you want to try any Games not on the PlayStation 4.  The down side is Microsoft bribes you to pay for 2 things,  XBox live gold & Xbox game pass.  Now the next XBox is coming in 2020 & Microsoft might try to charge a 3d Payment for Cloud Storage.  If you have a PC Desktop then use this over paying for 3 different Microsoft Subscriptions.  This is an Adult Opinion,  If I were a Teenager again with no Income, then maybe the Subscription is okay, if your Parent will pay the 180$ for a Year or 10$ a Month & 60$ for 1 year of XBox Gold.  Microsoft could still fail again after a horrible System Market Past.

The console looks amazing, and everything runs quite smooth, I recently had an interesting glitch however on the dash, it froze for like 15 seconds, at least 3 times... anyone else experiencing this issue? It was when I was downloading SW Battlefront 2... not sure if it was a memory cache issue or something with the dash itself... IdkOther than that it has beautiful graphics that you can tell are a step up from the One S depending on the game your playing and the type of 4K tv you have.

Console worked great for 6 months and then suddenly started malfunctioning (HDMI connectivity). Had geek squad come out and try to fix it (swapped cables, swapped TVs, messed with video fidelity settings, etc) and nothing fixed it. Eventually they told me to see about getting a replacement, because it was apparently a problem with the Xbox itself. Contacted the seller and they said no. ‚ÄúThe item is past amazon return timeframe‚Äù. Okay, but Microsoft gives them a 24 month auto warranty on new consoles. It should cost them nothing to help me out.Don‚Äôt buy here or if you do get the extended warranty.

The Xbox One X is beautiful and sleek. The picture quality is AMAZING. I see such a difference from my previous Xbox One. I honestly think it‚Äôs worth more than the price they‚Äôre asking. It feels crazy to say that because I am a frugal person. But it is literally the best quality I‚Äôve seen in a console. I bought it for my boyfriend and he‚Äôs more than happy with it! He highly recommends anybody to buy this Xbox. It also came with a badass controller. I got it in all black and I think it compliments our living room nicely!

Like many others on here I too received a faulty Xbox. Since day one it has continually given me the black screen of death when connecting to 4K, likely due to a faulty hdmi port on the console.  Now after a few months it has completely kicked the bucket. It will no longer connect to my tv at any resolution. I have tested it on multiple TVs using multiple hdmi cables and it is without a doubt a faulty console.

The system arrived a day early but did not include the power plug adapter. I Immediately messaged the seller and within a couple hours they issued me a refund including a link for me to purchase the plug adapter. I have it 4 star for the inconvenience but I am extremely impressed with how quick they responded and turned things around.

If you want the best gaming experience then this is the best route even if you're a PlayStation fan I recommend getting this console the prices for Xbox one x is going down and having a true 4K gaming experience is great and in all honesty Microsoft has the most exclusives to be pacific most of them are on the Xbox 360 but they're all compatible but the Xbox one x and so are the original Xbox games and most of them are extremely cheap this is the best route to go

Received the product and I noticed that both of the manufacture's seals were wrinkled as if had been opened before, so far did not noticed anything wrong, but it's very suspicious. I will update if anything is found, and will follow up with formal complaint.

Best hardware I've seen in a home console! Looks incredible on my 1080p plasma. Night and day difference.  The system Xbox should have released in the first place. Ready to get a 4K OLED next year. Only downside is Microsoft needs to get back to creating exclusive games outside of the couple dated feeling franchises they seem to depend on.  Fallout 4 is like a new game it looks so incredible along with ffxv, Wolfenstein 2, Halo, Gears and Forza. Also, I was blown away by how good old games look. Soul Caliber IV and Ninja Gaiden Black look almost like modern games!

I had 1 ps4 day one , 1 Ps4 Pro, 1 day One Xbox One and a Nintendo Switch in my house hold before I got this and baby boy you I gotta tell you this my favorite system out of all of them. It's fast, great design and just plain good quality. I can't speak on the graphics seeing as how I'm not getting a 4k TV till tomorrow and using my current TV as a reference would just be a disservice to this magnificent piece of hardware. I will say though, if you're on the fence about getting a Xbox One X please remember the next generation of consoles releases next year. (Scarlet) but if you can afford it then do yourself a favor and get the current most powerful console on the console on the market .

I got it for a good price. Despite the delivery people trying to get it stolen from me by placing it right in front of my house, it arrived with no issues. I added a 4tb memory with no problems and transferred my games to it. Everything was issue less. Games and 4k content look great.
Had an Xbox One S. Didn't notice much of an improvement. It was probably honestly a waste of money. Good console but not enough of an improvement from the One S.

The price is not bad for what you get. I upgraded from Xbox One, and was a great decision. It downloads and loads games much faster. It has a great picture, even without a 4K tv. It also does not get as hot as my old Xbox. If looking to upgrade, I highly recommend it!

Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt have a chance to use it all that much when I first got it. Once I used it, there were all sorts of memory issues.  The units consistently had to be reset to the factory settings, which were performed. Now all it gives me is an error message that does not let me make the factory resets.  I feel as if I was sold a car with a faulty engine.  The one star is for the times it did work without trouble.  Spent $400 on a big paperweight. Buyer beware!

I opened this box on November 8th and attempted to play several dvd's through the Blu-Ray app as well as several 360 Game discs that I confirmed were on the Backwards compatible list from Microsoft. None of these Discs were recognized, and nothing at all happened when they were inserted. Due to its used condition, its "1-year warranty" ran out over a year before I purchased it "Used - Like New" from this seller, so I am unable to get it repaired without extra cost on top of the cost to ship it to a repair facility, not to mention the Delay because of the Pandemic. I am in the process of getting it replaced and will update my review when I have a functioning device.

Totally worth the buy. Better graphics, Better connection/no lag, Better everything. It's quiet and doesn't have that stupid sensitive button that will turn your Xbox on and off when a breeze rolls by. If you play alot of Xbox, it's a night and day difference.
Arrived on launch day as promised and has been performing as promised. It looks incredible. Be sure to download Insects for it. It shows off the beautiful HDR and graphics.

I have 3 Xbox Ones, and WOW is this better than the previous 2.  The graphical upgrade is very nice on the games that are enhanced for the "X", but if you don't have a 4k TV it may not be worth the price at this time.  The loads times are not much faster than the "S", but the graphical power is a huge upgrade over previous versions.  Worth it if you have the money to spend.

Great console, warranty was 75% gone though. Console seemed to be defective after a few weeks of use. Picture would cut out, flicker, then be unable to resolve the correct resolution. Managed to get it working again after several tries unplugging the hdmi cord and plugging back in.  Will purchase again through Microsoft.

No, you cannot build a better pc for the same price and no, the ps4 pro, Nokia 3310 , or Nintendo switch cannot run games as good as the one x. It's a very powerful and versatile console all around. My only gripes with it are the lacking social ui, general menu ui, and the fact that you need wifi to set this device up for the first time

I got it for my son but its just like any PC it takes for ever to set up and gets to the point of confusion because Microsoft has so many log on that you don't know what's what and what should be available with unit and what is extra? Takes for ever to update. The graphics and picture is awsome

This is one of the consoles that I've been wanting for a long time. Xbox One X enhanced games just look amazing. Games load faster than how they were on the base Xbox One.However, there are a few things which I found disappointing with the console itself, and something that everyone needs to know. Its DVR doesn't record 1080p 60fps if you're using a 1080p TV; it only records 30fps. You need to have a 4K TV just to record 1080p 60fps. Even though it's supposed to accept USB 3.0/3.1 as an external storage, the console doesn't accept it if you're using a thumb stick USB 3.0 flash drive that's below 32 GB. It only accepts if it's 32 GB and above or you're using a HDD.

  ¬†First off, the original review was 2 stars, I'm changing this to one, purely because of the fact that it wasn't what's advertised, on top of the fact more people will see this.Now, I'm not sure what I should say here. I'm torn at the moment. I bet you're asking, why? I'll start from the beginning.  Let's go back in time, a few months, around early June. I was in the market for a One X, Forza was relevant and hot within my group, and I needed an upgrade from my Xbox 360. This was an extremely odd phase for Microsoft, as almost no One X's could be found new from their site. I took a peek at Microsoft's pricing as well. It was considerably lower than comparable vendors. All right, fine. This is about the period I would be scouring the internet, high and low, as I didn't want a One S, as that was seemingly an Xbox One in color, white, which I see as boring, and tasteless. If that's your thing, go for it, but I'm not feeling it. ESPECIALLY with the "all-digital" variation. So one day, I gave up after searching for long. Hard throughout more trusted distributors (i.e., Target, Best Buy, Even Gamestop), I eventually settled on Amazon of all places. Of course, I knew something of a rarity, especially being discontinued, would lead to some 'loose ends' somewhere, boy, I was right on that. I ordered with blind faith, ultimately hoping for the best. Order received. Great! Now I've got a One X on the way, an abnormally long shipping estimate, so just like any kid in a candy store would do, I start digging through the internet trying to learn every single thing about this Console. I see many reviews, unboxings, impressions, and I'll be honest, It's got me in a very excited state. The shipping date changes. It comes a few days early. Great! However, the package requires a signature. Ok. I'll get home from work, and I'll play on my Xbox and get lost in the immersive gaming experience! Let's say that's not what happened... Fortunately, someone was at my place when the Xbox came in, so it was signed for, thank god. All right! I open the box, and I'm blown away! It's such a clean looking professional box. That's great! As the Console had been discontinued at this point, I felt like the luckiest guy in the world. I opened the box; however, from my seller, I could tell this was substantially different from the Microsoft experience, at least as far as I was concerned. I was missing My Xbox Live Gold, My Documentation, Everything! But I didn't know about this at the time. Little did I know as well. My warranty was already missing a majority of its lifespan. I open the box, I take extra care as not to damage anything, The Console seems to be in really nice physical condition, weighs a lot as expected, but something feels off, "Seattle -> You" badge seems really sloppy, I take it was likely refurbished with a Chinese case after some heavy use, or a very careless/'unknowing as to how to care to it' ownership.  Not a problem. To me, It's just an Xbox that got lost in quality control, oh well. Well, I got everything plugged in. It started. However, I noticed something... odd... The startup '4K Chip' Scene was extremely laggy. I tested this on my 4K TV and my 1080p monitor. Same result. Odd.  This detail wasn't a problem. On Reddit, others said this could occur after just a few days. I downloaded Forza Horizon 4. I had played FH4 on PC for a while. I bought this Xbox to use multiplayer as my PC was inoperable in that field. I have a decent computer, so I know how lovely the graphics are. After getting all of my content synced, I was able to play. Now, I get this was a 400 dollar console new, but this didn't look very good. Constant stuttering, like it, had been hit with a hammer a few times for sure. I wasn't sure what to expect, considering I was so new in this field, but with bold claims like "Xbox One X Enhanced," among others, I was expecting a little better. Marketing hoo-ha (Read till the end, I'm not nitpicking) as far as I'm concerned. Now, This is all right. I bought Xbox Live Gold as it was an excellent deal at the time. Now, I started downloading other things and testing features. My controller was nice. I liked the way it felt for sure. That's one of the nice parts about the One X I received. I also read that there was a 4K Blu-Ray Player on board, so that's pretty awesome. I tried it out with a generic DVD. It was a brand new movie. I put the disc in. I felt a little resistance at first, oh well. It went in; the movie looked nice, what a nice feature! I pulled the disc out to put it away, well, unfortunately, It's scratched. Not sure if it was the quality of the CD or what, live and learn is what they say. As I experimented, I realized I didn't have a good home for this Xbox, It didn't work as advertised, and I let it stand for a while. I just had zero urge to play. I was ultimately depressed. I spent this much money on a used piece of junk. I put it in the box and left it in the corner for a while. Now, This is one of the EXTREMELY RARE stories that has both sides of the story. Shortly after, I was browsing Microsoft again for one of these, even though I thought it was going to be the same result. *Add to Cart* Are you telling me, I can buy a new one of these... from Microsoft? I dropped everything I was doing and bought it on the spot for 38 dollars less than the one from Direct Distributor. Great! The best part? One. Day. Delivery. That was AMAZING to have it overnighted for 15 dollars shipping. You can tell I was likely pretty excited. I unboxed it, and It had all the documentation I wanted, plus extra! Now, this Console was a late 2017 model, which I've heard are pretty prone to overheating. I bought a vertical stand for it, similar to the one from Project Scorpio. It gives the Console enhanced airflow. At this point, from my old Console to this, with a cooked graphics card on the original, I take extra precautions every time I use this one. It has it's own corner, and it gets moved to the center of the desk every time it has the lovely time of being used. Now, This one has ZERO lag on startup. It was AMAZING! I got Forza installed, it runs almost perfectly, not PC level, but It's nice. I have about 50 hours into it now. I play it less these days because of time restraints; however, It was night and day difference. Skyrim runs awesome, of course. The Blu-Ray is even better (and doesn't bite). The controller was revision #1, so not the same. However, a controller is much easier to replace than a whole unit, especially discontinued. I still believe I got an Xbox One X from the last batch Microsoft will ever sell. On top of this, My warranty was in full, and I've got my whole Console again. The wifi is smooth, the browsing is great, and this thing is my queen, practically. What should you take from this? Well, from the time of writing this, The Xbox Series S is 300 and will be up for preorder seven days from now, available right in time for the holidays. SO MUCH POWER for so little money, The Series X costs less than a wild card Xbox One X on here. Now, Here's The Verdict.Seller: Being Direct Distributor, They had some EXTREMELY high ratings, which was lovely; however, I believe that this was an incredibly irresponsible and wrong decision on their end to send a console labeled NEW as a poor refurb. However, Even though I missed the return date, on top of the fact they say you're not allowed to return game consoles, they gave me all my money back after being in limbo for a few days. Incredible experience overall, so I hate them and love them at the same time.The Console: I'm saying this from the perspective of my NEW One X from Microsoft. It's an AMAZING console, a significant upgrade as far as the 360 goes. It's so much different than my, so quiet, so powerful, and a dream to use.Right Now: Don't buy this Console, anywhere. It's far too expensive, it's dated hardware, and it offers an older design that in the 2017's is prone to overheating failure, don't bring me back to that issues on the 360. No good. However, I would go for the Series S, 300 dollars for Next-gen stuff? Or 12 Teraflops on the Series X for 63 dollars less than "New" asking on here right now? No thanks. Save yourself the money, and buy something even better. Thanks For Reading.Name: Jake O'MalleySeller: Direct Distributor

I've been an Xbox fanboy for years, so it was a no-brainer when they announced the Scorpio that I would be lining up to get one. As it was I ended up getting one about a month after release due to not having a 4K TV. I knew it wouldn't matter that much, but I figured if I was going to experience it the right way I might as well go all the way. Once I got the new 4K TV I knew it was time to order the Xbox One X.Let me tell you, watching 4K streaming from Amazon Instant Video or Netflix or 4K Blu-rays on the Xbox One X is so beautiful! Add in the fact that many games do have updated graphics to take advantage of the Xbox One X's improved power, including HDR, and gaming has taken on a whole new level. I don't believe the 4K gaming is the same jump up in graphics as 1080p was from standard def, but it is noticeable and worth every penny.If I have one complaint about the system, it's that it still freezes up on games from time to time. And every once in awhile you'll get stuttering in a game when too much is going on on the screen. That was one of the things that the Xbox One X was supposed to fix and not have happen as often, so hopefully now that the hardware is out there, new games that are made with the Xbox One X in mind will not have the problems that the current games with updated settings have.

From faster load times, to games such as Battlefield 1 running at solid 60 fps, this console upgrade was well worth it. Being that Microsoft sold so many units of the X, game developers will look to utilize its power to maximize game performance for future titles. I play on a 1080p monitor and the difference in quality is noticeable even though a selling point is 4k gaming.

Let me start by saying I have always owned all consoles (luckily my day job has allowed me the options): Nintendo, Sony and Microsoft, so I'm not particularly a fanboy of any one of them. At the start of this generation "war", I definitely favored the PS4. The stats and promised exclusives were more appealing to me than the XB1 at the outset, but I purchased the clunky-to-look-at, $500 XB1 anyway, including the required add-on and subsequently ill-fated Kinect alongside my PS4. It didn't get a whole lot of playtime, outside of the exclusives like Halo 5, Titanfall, and Gears and a few of the Live Gold freebies, and of course the FAR-superior video streaming service support/selection. But when the XB1X was announced and promised support for 4k gaming and 4k Blu-ray, my ears pricked up.This is the definitive home console experience right now if you have the display to take advantage of it. Gone are the huge external power supply and the hefty Kinect; this is pure, streamlined gaming power for the living room. The console runs very quiet (in fact, I don't think I've ever noticed noise out of it while playing a game). I have a late-2016 model (relatively) high-end 4K LG TV, and even that doesn't quite allow me to take full advantage of the HDR 4k capabilities. I can display in 4k resolution, but hit some roadblocks in the HDR department so this really is bleeding-edge technology for a gaming console. It looks great on my display, but it makes me want to splurge for something that takes full advantage.Bottom line: if you have a 4k display, this is the best you're going to get for multi-platform games (outside of a high-end gaming PC, which can run upwards of $2k, not including the cost of the 4k display), exclusives and 4k streaming services. AC Origins plays noticeably smoother on the 1X than the original XB1 and Shadows of War looks a lot better on the XB1X as well, to give a couple examples. If you have the means and the display, this is the console you should be playing on.
