Wish I could post a zero star review, nothing is more frustrating then spending $500 on a console and receiving a much much cheaper console, I currently have a broken leg and am out of work, so I don't have many other things I can do, so now instead of being excited to play on this new super console I have to wait up to two weeks for a refund and then I can order what was originally suppose to be shipped to my house

First off I started out on the Playstation as a young Marine in 95 but as a convert to the Xbox this was the console we should have got on instead of the Xboner. I did not purchase mine through Amazon but decided to take a drive into Houston to pick mine up at a Gamestop and have enjoyed every minute of ditching my original Xbone i'm currently playing on a 1080p tv and enjoying the vast improvement of many of my older games like the Witcher 3 and others I have yet to decide if I want to make the jump to a 4k as I see no need to. I did have one instance of a power issue but I only had to unplug my Xbox one X from the wall for a few seconds and plug it back in I tend to leave my system in low power with a fast turn on and decided to full shutdown when not in use other than that the console runs great.

I had swore off Xbox for life after the myriad of problems I had with my Xbox 360. I was a day 1 owner, and I received the red ring of death. Microsoft had sent me about 3 refurbished units that all eventually did the same thing before my warranty expired. I had a log of probably 40 games that were rendered useless as I was NOT going to pay them to send me yet another Refurbished unit. I thought I was done with them for good, and I've been enjoying my PS3 and PS4 since. During Christmas of 2017 however there was a sweet deal on an Xbox One S with Forza Horizon 3, so I gave in and gave them another chance. Besides a left trigger that was slightly wobbly and loose on the controller I was so impressed with the S that upgrading to the X was a no brainer when I got my 4K TV. I bought mine through Gamestop. I was very happy initially with the way games ran, and looked. The problem was that the internet kept disconnecting from the Xbox. I was using a wired ethernet connection, had the quick start mode enabled etc...., but when signing back on after putting the console to sleep I noticed downloads would be paused from the prior night, and not downloaded like I expected. After looking in to my router settings I found that the Xbox was doing a random total disconnect from my internet after I put it to sleep. Also since the Xbox was disconnecting from the Internet while in quick start mode it wouldn't start up with the Xbox app on my phone either. The problem seemed to be remedied by using a wireless connection, but I wanted to use wired. I finally took it back to gamestop citing what I assume to be an issue with the ethernet port, and they gave me another one. This second unit I'm happy to report is awesome, runs flawlessly, and has none of those problems with disconnecting from the internet thus far. The only issue with this unit is that the controller that came with this one is not quite seamed/fused together near the left trigger button, and I can tell it's a little loose there. It's not a big deal, and the controller works fine, but it is just another example that Xbox still has some quality control issues they need to sort out. When buying any of their products be very thorough in checking that EVERYTHING works as advertised. 3 different units from 2 different vendors, and I've had small problems with each. If you can snag one that is in complete working order it is an amazing console. If it weren't for these ridiculous quality control issues, and the sluggish speed of the Microsoft store through the console I would have given it 5 stars.
Controller is broken

It IS the best console ever made (to date).PROS:- PROCESSORX technically has the best hardware outside of a PC. That's why you're here. It's solid, steady, runs silent most of the time. Mine is used routinely and doesn't overheat.- HD4K streaming, 4K gaming, UHDs (PS4 CANNOT play them), HDR, HD Enhanced titles, Dolby vision, Dolby Atmos (this was the first device to support Atmos to my knowledge or at least it was the first one on the Dobly Atmos site anyway).- HDMI inHDMI in allows you to view another device on your Xbox One. Some use this to add cable boxes, external OTA tuners or other devices. Theoretically you could view an Xbox 360, PS4 or anything that outputs a signal via HDMI (not sure how well that'd work but it might be possible...could you connect ANOTHER Xbox One into an Xbox One and have Xbox One-ception?) I haven't had a cable subscription in years but I love the way the Xbox One will show your channel line-up with cable, satellite or OTA and I love that it auto-plays in a little window while scrolling through the lineup. I do have an antenna and the local channel line up is there...- INSTALLEase of installing, moving titles. If purchased digitally, games automatically show in your queue and auto install if desired. You can install a game digitally from a 1 Xbox to another Xbox (generally faster than doing so by downloading) via a network install. Hide or unhide titles from your "ready to install" area if desired. Sort titles by size, use, alphabetical...Games update themselves automatically.- HOME XBOXIf you have 2 or more Xboxes, you can play your stuff on 1 Xbox and another person can play your stuff on the "home" Xbox at the same time having access to the same game library and same licenses meaning you won't have to buy them twice...- ACCOUNT-BASEDCloud saves. You can log into any Xbox One anywhere (as long as it has an internet connection), download your stuff (if it isn't already there) and play whatever it is, wherever you are...This is a major improvement over prior generations. No more carrying around a save file or hard drive...If a game is lost or hard drive dies, your saves are still there.- PREVIEW PROGRAMInsider, preview program, skip ahead, preview new features faster (if you can get approved for it).- MUSICPlay music with an app while playing a game and control volume of each.- BACKWARD COMPATIBILITYSelect Xbox 360 and Xbox Original title backward compatibility (many/most of the good games are there). There are so many 360 compat titles that everyone in the house has completely abandoned the 360.- GAME PASSGold, Game Pass and Ultimate. Gold gets you 4 games per month now - that'd be roughly 50/yr (they're not all great of course but some are). Game Pass gets you over 100+ games (possibly over 200 by the time you read this). You could upgrade Gold or Game Pass to Ultimate for $1 during E3 2019 and have access to over 100+ games for the same amount of time you have Gold. Have Gold for 3 years? You now have Game Pass for 3 years for $1. This was an insane deal. When Gears5 comes out you play it free. When Halo6 comes out you play it free. And so on. Game Pass will soon come to PC.- COMMUNITIESGroups, Looking for groups, communities to find people who play the same things you do.- ACHIEVEMENTSAchievement system improvements, diamond (rare) achievements, achievement progress, weekly or monthly achievements, etc...- VIDEO CAPTUREEditing and uploading screenshots, videos is improved, fast (but where you can upload them is still lacking).- MIXERMS's commitment to Mixer in the face of Amazon's endless money to support Twitch is admirable. Mixer doesn't have the Twitch brand name cache, but it appears to work well...- CROSS-PLAYImproved 3rd party platform experiences. Xbox / Windows crossover -- some Xbox games you purchase can be played on a PC and with an Xbox controller if desired. Xbox app appearing on Nintendo store, crossover play with other platforms on select titles. Xbox will now support GOG, Steam, others...- NEW DEVSSerious acquisitions of very good developers like Obsidian (Fallout), DoubleFine, Compulsion, etc. Acquisitions of titles like Gears seem obvious...- CONTROLLERThe new Xbox One controller with bluetooth and headphone jack is basically the standard controller in the gaming industry because it's just that good - it's solid. They even put rumblers in the triggers. My only complaint is it's hard to dissemble and mod (there are 2 boards and some of the things you would want to remove - you can't easily).- COOL APPSKodi is pretty awesome and the fact that those devs are trying to keep the app working on Xbox One is wonderful.- LEADERSHIPPhil Spensor and Major Nelson are great guys. Actual gamers. They know what they're doing.-----CONS:- SNAPRemoval of "snap" (picture in picture or app in app) feature. This was definitely a cool feature.- EXCLUSIVESMany exclusives have been slow, lacking, meh or disappointing this console generation, e.g. Crackdown. They made a big deal about Crackdown (a game most of us had fun with but had forgotten about). When it was released, it was just okay...Nothing to write home about. Still, many of the best titles are going to be multi-platform anyway. Red Dead Redemption 2 was probably the best title of 2018 and it will probably look and play best on Xbox One X.- SOCIAL MEDIADeeper social media integration still has a little bit to catch up (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc).- FORUMThe old Xbox forum was more of a community reddit-like experience and it's virtually dead now. Most people don't use the forum (does it even exist at all?) and go to individual developer/publisher sites instead...- HDRThe way some apps use HDR (Netflix) has been chaotic and confusing (this appears to be Netflix's fault).- SSDLack of a sku with internal SSD (this would obviously increase the price of the console so I understand why they haven't done it this generation).- KINECTThis doesn't really apply to the newer Xbox One models anymore but the initial force bundling of Kinect was a cost bungle on Don Mattrick's part. MS's complete abandoning of the device years later feels wimpy. All you need is 1 killer app to breathe life into the device.-----OTHER NOTES:If you're trying to decide between Xbox One S or X, I can tell you as someone who uses both constantly, yes the S will be much cheaper but it feels incredibly slow and sluggish compared the the X. I'd say IF you are someone who games causally, intermittently (not daily), has 30 or less games, the S should be fine for you. BUT if you're more of a power user, pick the X and feel all those teraflops all over your face. And the PC master race? Comb the cheetos our of your neckbeard. You already feel superior so what are you doing here with us console babies?

Bought what I thought was a new Xbox one X. Turned it on only to find someone else had not only signed into the Xbox but had downloaded a ton of games and my storage was being used. I feel lied to and ripped off. If it's pre-owned, give a discount or let people know. Not cool mallstop who ever the hell you are.

It pains me to say, after being possibly the biggest Xbox 360 fanboy of all time, I have probably never regretted any single purchase in my life as much as my Xbox One console. I call it the Netfli-X-Box, because that's all it's good for. Microsoft was so focused on turning it into a glorified cable box with Skype and ESPN, (because video game nerds care so much about televised sports that they wouldn't have cable if not for their Xbox?) that they forgot to make any good games for their game console.Scrolling through the overly stuffed games library, you will be hard pressed to find anything that is not either A: A side scrolling platformer, B: A topdown shooter, C: A walking simulator puzzle game, D: A retro through back so the lack of pixels is excusable, or D: A mainly text-based adventure game. It's like Team Xbox is trying to bring back PC gaming circa 1998 so they could be even lazier when designing their games. Of course, that would be giving them far too much credit, because they aren't trying to design almost any games at all.That's right, disguised as a "platform for indie developers pitch" Microsoft has passed off almost all of their consoles game production to inexperienced small studios and it shows SO MUCH, like diarrhea in a wedding dress after a few bad hors d'oeuvres. I mean, sure, it's fine to give a few indie developers a break, even though the total lack of quality control leaves you with a jumbled mess of practically carbon copy garbage all over the games library, but you are a game production company, you have to produce games for your console too. Most games, even on the oh-so-powerful Xbox One X, look bad for an original Xbox game, this is what happens when you leave all the game making to the literal amateurs and cancel the only decent looking exclusive you've ever had for the dumbest reasons I've ever heard (R.I.P. Scalebound).In summary, if they're not going to put any effort into it, don't put your money into it. It is literally pointless to own an Xbox One at this point in time, added X or otherwise, because there are NO GAMES on this GAME CONSOLE. At least barely any that aren't already playable with higher fidelity and better frame rates on other consoles with countless more exclusives of their own whereas I struggle to think of almost any Xbox exclusives that weren't extremely underwhelming. I gave it a shot Microsoft, I really did, you kept getting your fans hopes up and sending them straight back down to rock bottom. But hey, at least you can play hundreds of games you can also probably play on literally any modern smartphone (for a quarter of the price on them) with barely better resolution on a big, immovable block the size of 4 complete hardcover collectors editions of the Lord of the Rings trilogy lined up next to each other, taking up too much space for too much money for too little reason.Well, at least I can still watch my streaming services with slightly more ease of typing than my Apple TV, even though they constantly crash because Microsoft couldn't even get the completely extraneous things to the purpose of the product right that they wasted all of their money on, apparently leaving little to none for the whole point, the GAMES. 2 out of 5 for the two things it's good at, being a big ugly coaster and a decent rig for a good ol' Netflix and chill session, what an amazing achievement...

Couldn‚Äôt ask for a better system. It is fast, incredible graphics, and I have had no issues with it at all. I am an avid gamer and have had this system for almost a year now and would 10/10 buy it again

Let me be clear here.  For the 2 hours i had the xbox one x up and running i was in love.  It's sleek, heavy and just hypnotic in some ways to look at.  This is the system that my original xbox one, should have been.  I took it out of its package, also the packaging felt more like an apple or google product than the last three xbox, xbox 360 and xbox one have felt like.I was in love from the moment i pulled it out of the box.  Plugged it in, and downloaded the mandatory day one update, no problems whatsoever.I had moved my original xbox (OX)  one to the main tv, as I wanted to have it act as a bluray player and streaming box for when the wife and I want to watch tv on it.To my surprise, as i logged into my fancy new console, my OX would log out.  Perplexed and with a rising sense of panic on just spending $500 on a system that would be unusable in my home's configuration, I went online to figure out what was happening.As it turns out, MS doesn't allow a person to use one xbox live membership in two locations at once.  Since this was my house i thought surely i can game, while the wife watches netflix on my OX, using my gold to link it.  I was wrong.Now i have a magnificent new console, that costs $500, and after searching through online articles for an hour I realized the truth.  I would need to return one system or the other, or buy another xbox live gold membership.There is something called "home" xbox which MS allows you to do, but this did not fit my needs.  In turn i sent my system back.  I hope someone gets it on a warehouse deal, as its a great system, and i want it back badly.  However i'm not willing to throw out, sell my OX (which runs fine), or pay another $60 for a mostly unused gold membership.Once the OX goes i'll def get another X, there's no question however, MS needs to figure this situation out.  Its ridiculous.

I have been really disappointed with the X Box One X. I have changed from the PS to X Box and it's been a really bad purchase especially for the money that you pay for it. So backstory: I am an avid gamer, and have been gaming since OG Xbox. I currently pair this with a 55 inch 4k t.v.I have had every gen XBox/Playstation. I went through original XBox to 360, and from 360 to original XBox 1, to a One S when we first bought our 4k t.v. in 2016, to the X.This gen each xbox traded up, my 360 elite went to get the Xbox One, which went to get the S, which went to get the X- to mitigate cost of investment. Trading in my S netted me the X for approx $235, a deal I couldn't pass up.To be frank, the reviews speak volumes of this XBox and they are no lie. Paired next to the PS4 Pro, the XBox outshines in gaming and doubles for family media like Netflix, blu ray 4k movies, etc.Honestly? I will be keeping the One X the same as we kept our original XBox. It will not be getting traded in for next generation. It stands testament to the quality that can exist in the console space, which isn't always spectacular. The One X is a gem of a system, and wholeheartedly earns the praise it has right now.One issue to note for planned long term ownership: Microsoft skimped on the heat paste utilized for the on board chip. It dries out, fast! It isn't a forefront issie yet but will eventually be as systems overheat over long term use. That being said? I have ran ours daily for 8 monthes so far no issue- and it gets heavy use at our household. I thuroughly expect to have to open the system up at some point in the next year to upgrade/renew the heat paste, and this will be an issue for many day 1 release consoles as well. Not too bad if you are tech savvy, and if not- prepare for the investment to have a computer repair shop do it for you, or Microsoft. It is the key to longevity of the X, and its sole weakness other than in time it won't be the fancy new car on the block anymore.One thing I will say is it will stand testament to the quality of gaming for this generation, and is worth a spot paired to any 4k t.v. for XBox and non Xbox gamers alike. If you are not avide on XBox? This is the console to win your heart over!

I purchased the Xbox One X Gold Rush Edition about 4 days ago and...I'm disappointed. I am a true tech nerd and love video games (PC and Console) and I am disgusted that Microsoft would use such cheap HDD's paired with actual decent processing power. Rendering in 4k or even 1440p for games like Battlefield V, Battlefield 1, The Division, ESO, and Final Fantasy XV are literally made retarded by the Seagate HDD they've installed. It takes several seconds after the fact for textures and various details to appear in game. Not to mention the dried out thermal paste I found on the processor. The thermal pads weren't even aligned entirely over the RAM! It looked like a 8yo got ahold of an applicator of compound and had some fun. I properly cloned a 2tb SSD in place of the HDD and it made a godly world of difference. It went from 65 seconds to load FFXV to 21 seconds after the swap. Not to mention rendering is immediate.This hurts me Microsoft. I'm sticking to PC from now on.

Unimpressed.I pre-ordered this thing directly from Microsoft. It's a monster they said. Well, yes it is, in the sense that not a day goes by that something doesn't work. Literally every day it stops working and has to be restarted. The biggest problem is media related apps rarely work without restarting the box. Try to open one, it just hangs, throws an error code, and then tells you to restart. I've wiped the machine, reinstalled everything, etc., multiple times, yet the problem persists. I've reported it to Microsoft numerous times, to no avail.It's pretty obvious Microsoft has given up on the entertainment side of Xbox outside of gaming itself. My $30 Fire stick wipes the floor with the Xbox.On the gaming side of things I honestly don't notice much of a difference. I even upgraded my old plasma to an OLED and from my viewing distance it makes no material difference.This monster doesn't live up to the hype or the price tag.

Update: Microsoft store gave me the price I was expecting when I went to return the unit, so although still annoyed, I am no longer pissed off.I paired the One X with a 75" Samsung QLED 6 series I purchased on Amazon. The net effect is impressive, met my high expectations. Enhanced graphics are noticeably better, games in 4 k look slightly more detailed even after stretching from the 55" tv I am accustomed to, to 75". Effects like rolling for and stuff like that look thicker and more real. 4 player split screen Rocket League is like having 4 √ó 37 inch 1080 screens on one tv, and feels graphically equivalent to powering each screen with its own original XBOX one. My son reports that spawned creatures in subnotica look so much better on x vs original that they are practically unrecognizable. Netflix in 4K is breathtaking. As an unexpected bonus, the TV remote controls the Xbox, which is fantastic.Original review: I made the mistake of dealing directly with the Microsoft store on black friday where I was misled into paying full price for a console that everybody, including microsoft, had on sale for $100 less that day. Unfortunately, the store didn't list any prices and I failed to realize that the Microsoft store was in the business of gouging its walk in customers on Black Friday. As soon as I noticed that I had paid more than the advertised price, I called Microsoft to get it fixed. I found myself dealing with a hapless call center employee who wore their powerlesness to help me like a shield.

With the obvious caveat that you need to have a 4K HDR-capable TV to see the difference, the Xbox One is amazing and I wish I hadn't dithered on my decision to get one for so long. I have a high-end PC (using a GTX 1070 8 GB version) and while the technical performance isn't quite as good since it'd be impossible to expect a console to do that, this is the closest any console has ever come to any PC I've ever had. The resolution from 1080p to 4k is noticeable but not as dramatic as, say, the jump from SD to 1080i/p was but what really makes the difference is HDR. The Forza games in particular are stunning, real life doesn't even look that good. Just about all the AAA releases coming out now are "Enhanced" (meaning they are in native 4k with HDR), and Microsoft has made a good faith effort to upgrade all its big first party titles to 4K and work with publishers to do so as well.
For me it doesn't worth the money, i still prefer the one S

Hard to say where to start. I try to watch a Blu-ray and it crashes. My Xbox frequently loses signal with the wireless controllers. My Xbox frequently loses my video settings. One second my 4K tv is going well and my video or my audio goes away. And when I‚Äôve needed assistance from Xbox there‚Äôs no documented history so you start with square one when troubleshooting. Terrible. Absolutely intolerable. The console has had issues since the very first week of ownership. I believe it is an issue with a faulty hard drive. Constantly makes me do factory resets and delete my save data just to work for a day or two at most. I was inspired to write this review because I've literally spent the last hour desperately trying to get my console to work long enough to play For Honor with friends. I bought an external hard drive to put my games on just so I could speed up the process by not actually deleting my games. The "terabyte" hard drive can't hold any games because of these issues, so I would have been forced to buy an external anyway.I've been an Xbox user for a decade now. This problem? This encouraged me to make  the switch to PC. The only things keeping me resuscitating this brick with wishful thinking and broken dreams every day are my friends that don't have PC's yet, the fact that I'm extremely close to 100,000 gamerscore, the fact that I foolishly bought Cyberpunk 2077 and want to see if the Xbox will hold out to launch, and that I'm unwilling to do the grind for all my stuff on  PC right now.I will never buy another Xbox console at full price. This experience has burned me too much. I may never buy an Xbox console again.What makes matter worse is that there are no great solutions to my problem. I've tried looking my issue up online and Microsoft emplyees' official answer to the problem has essentially been, "have you dang old tried turning that thing off and on again?" Why yes, I have! In fact- I've moved my chair right next to my Xbox so it's easier to do so! Sending the Xbox for potential repair also isn't an option at the moment since there's a slightly worrying pandemic affecting the world and making money rather tight.The Error messages I get that are listed are but a few of the ones I get. Those are just the pictures I've taken. I understand that the "Preparing Console" message doesn't mean anything on its own, but please trust in me when I say that I've done at least five factory resets in the last hour alone.Just get a PC so that you can listen to music while playing games and talking to your friends all at the same time. I bought a SkyTech Gaming PC for around $730 (including three year warranty) that has yet to give me issues.

Austin LanphierAppraisal Assignment1/31/18English 302The Xbox one X is the most modern Xbox gaming system. If you have the right entertainment systems, it can offer some of the best game play experiences. It has a lot new features which offer faster speed, better cooling, and higher resolution than any of its predecessor, however, with all the gaming systems out there it is important to ask yourself if the Xbox one X is worth the extra money.Questions to ask before buying your game system.1) How much are you willing to spend?2) How often will you use the gaming system?3) Do you have other friends with the gaming system and if you want to play online do they also play online?4) Are there any games that you want which are specific to a certain console?5) Is the gaming system best supported by your current T.V. and if not would you be willing to upgrade?In my opinion the Xbox one X is the best gaming system around, but it may not be the best option for everyone. There are other options which will save you a lot of money, get you the same games, and still offer an impressive gameplay experience.The perfect customer for an Xbox one X would ideally,1) Have a 4k T.V. -If you do not have a 4K T.V. an Xbox one S may be the best option.2) Plan on playing games over 7-8 hours each week3) Play games online frequently4) Be willing to spend over $600 initially for the console as well as some game I use my Xbox around 9-10 hours each week and play a lot of games online and I have a 4k T.V. so I think that the one X was a good purchase for me and worth the extra money. It is really great for online playing since it does not lag as much as a one S would, for games that I am not playing online I do not see a huge difference between mine and my friends one S.If you play games less frequently, or are just short on cash then the Xbox one S still offers the same games and has a much cheaper price tag. The visual experience of an Xbox one S will also be the same as an Xbox one X unless you have a 4K T.V., the biggest downfall in my opinion would be the slower processor speeds. For anyone who is looking for the best gaming experience around, you cannot go wrong with the Xbox one X. I would be happy to recommend this product to anyone!

Product is advertised as a 4K disc player. Unlike other 4K players it does NOT let you play Blu Ray or 4K discs unless you first create an account to give Xbox all your info, then you have to download an app called Blu-Ray Player. I've never heard of any Blu-Ray player requiring you to download an app, so I assume the purposes must be to track all the consumer's data as well as send more marketing bombardments. It's cumbersome to use, keeps freezing, just making a mistake logging in can trap you in loops where it won't recognize passcodes. Game aspect functions satisfactorily. But definitely NOT worth $500. If it was priced at $150 I'd probably give it 4 or 5 stars. But at $500 there shouldn't be any headaches.

Admittedly, I don‚Äôt spend much time on games like I used to, but boy was I excited to get my hands on the latest and greatest! After a few months with it, I have fully come to terms with my buyer‚Äôs remorse. I should have bought the PlayStation 4 Pro for the more reasonable price and the exclusive games. Sony is an electronics company AND a major entertainment company. That should have been my first indication. Microsoft is a company that makes money selling licenses for clunky software. To each their own I guess, so if you like paying a monthly subscription fee for Microsoft Office you might love the Xbox One X.This thing is a big dumb ad machine‚Äîan ad machine that for $500 doesn‚Äôt even come with a rechargeable controller (AA batteries out the box like a boss). It has the most processing power on the market and it uses all that processing power to market. The upsells are endless. I paid way too much for this thing to play games, stop putting me through the timeshare pitch (that‚Äôs right, they sell videogames with the same terms of use as vacation property in Myrtle Beach‚ÄîPay only X dollars and get this game two weeks out of every year!).Review must update...Which brings me to the interface. The interface is like Times Square on a hot summer day complete with building sized ads and naked cowboys begging for change. The interface is terrible. If I put a disk in, I want to game. I don‚Äôt want to unintuitively wade through a teen bro‚Äôs digital stream of consciousness.Playing games isn‚Äôt great and it isn‚Äôt nearly as simple as it should be. On a number of occasions when I‚Äôve tried to just sit and play a game this thing either needed to update the system or the game or it wasn‚Äôt connected to the internet so I couldn‚Äôt play (even in single player offline mode). The controller disconnects often in the middle of use. And this thing eats my household bandwidth to update even when I‚Äôm not using it. My kids don‚Äôt even like it.The Xbox One X is a Mclaren super car without a steering wheel. Don‚Äôt expect to ever just take it out for a spin and be ready for high ownership costs.

Waste of hard earned money!It worked for 3 weeks only!It‚Äôs really frustrating and very sorry I spent a lot of money on this junk.Microsoft is really bad!Do not buy!

We bought an xbox 1 only to find out that in order to play fortnite, you need to spend 10 dollars a month for the game pass, then after it updated you need to spend another 10 dollars a month for the gold pass. My 10 year old son spent his own birthdat money to upgrade to the game pass so he could play fortnite now since it upgraded and they want more money ( an extra 10 dollars a month) he is just out that money.We are getting rid of this piece of crap and buying the PS4, it doesn't charge you money to play its games.

I can't possibly ever say how bad this console is. I wouldn't even have to mention the competition if I didn't want to. In fact, if I had a choice between an Xbox One and nothing I'd choose death.Microsoft is an inherent problem with the way they push their products and services. It seems like compared to literally any other consumer product I've ever owned, only MS would bother shoving ads down my throat right when I get to the home screen. Not to mention I have been so legitimately ill of the update requirements, I've been forced to come here and warn other people of this plague. Again, they have such a raging hard-on with forcing me to update everything I am often prevented from using the console for anything other than a 4K Bluray machine until the 20-40gb downloads I didn't ask for are done. This is a problem because at the moment I don't want to spend more on faster internet (not when unlimited 4G has been everything I need) much less a console that doesn't make anything easier than the competitors.What else is an atrocity, is Forza 4 just keeps crashing. I didn't have this problem before I could update Halo or any other game. Yet a game you would expect to at least start right out of the box apparently had no quality control for such a thing. I'd go so far as to argue this is something that may keep Sony ahead because what good is 40% more power if you're so obsessed with locking your customers down with update requirements just to START the game or console. I totally get it if the application can't use network features while not updated, but if I want to play OFFLINE then start the game just like I wanted and update later.Now that we've mildly described some issues with the unbelievable forced updates, lets talk about how worthless this OS is. I like Windows. I just don't like Windows 10 or the modified variant on this console. The reason is simple. In extremely simple tasks, the world's most powerful console STRUGGLES to close a game or turn off the wifi (so I can turn it back on and have it discover a network). It'll just sit there and spin until I turn it off or go back to the home page. If I go back to the homepage, and then return to a setting where it hung up, it often didn't make any change and I have to try again. Again, this is something an unnamed competitor device can do instantly without fail 100% of the time.I'm so frustrated because I want to see Xbox succeed but apparently it's more important to show ads I can't remove on the home screen, and force me to update before I do ANYTHING even if I could opt out of using Xbox Live at all. This is all to mention there is very few games exclusively on this console and while a few more are coming there's nothing truly groundbreaking or fresh.When this machine bothers to function like I want it to, I'm reminded of my interest in it. That doesn't come often though. I can say that the HDMI IN port is quite an interesting novelty and the backwards compatibility allows me to play Mass Effect or Fable (just remember you have to download the games for some unholy reason despite having the disc) on a fast, quiet console. That's the only two things I actually care about no other 8th Gen system can do. One day they'll catch up. Maybe that's what the "One" is for. "One day"

Got the Xbox One X as a gift and I have a PS4 pro already. Let me start off by saying I‚Äôve been a die hard Sony PSN fanboy for years and have owned all PlayStations. The Xbox is a game changer to say the least. I‚Äôm playing RDR2, D2 forsaken, and black ops 4 on the one x and it is incredible! PS4 pro display looks old and is laggy compared to the one x. One X runs smooth and displays naitive 4K. Sony has some catching up to do with this one so we‚Äôll see how the PS5 stacks up in a couple of years. For now Xbox One X is the superior console.

Let me start by saying that the console does its job. It does it well in fact. Load times are considerably faster than other Xbox systems. There is no part where the faster and better doesn't deliver. Playing with my friends, I am often waiting up to a minute for them to  join a session that we both started loading at the same time. It's small and it checks all the boxes. However what it comes with that it doesn't mention anywhere, is a very loud fan. Out of the box, it is whisper quiet. That will not last though. I bought a X day one and it got so loud that I swore it was damaged. I contacted Microsoft and arranged a replacement. They use different terminology, but essentially I paid a small amount to get a used console. Sent that back. I didn't want a used one; I just bought a 500 dollar console. After that struggle, my console was just sent in for a warranty repair. 'Everything checked out.' I got it back with a clean bill of health. But still loud as ever and pretty much exactly how it left me weeks prior. I'm talking, there is a dust storm blowing down trees outside. Legitimately, that is what I thought. It sounds like the loudest computer fan you've ever heard of, or the Xbox 360 before the rings of death. Ultimately, I was recommended to take it a physical Microsoft store and ask for help. On goodwill, I received a new unit and it remained quiet, not silent, for a while. Until now, I find myself writing this. Any premium graphics game will ignite the fan. If I sound bothered by it, it is because I am. It is recommended to keep the unit unenclosed, which it is. It isn't even under a shelf. I don't even look at the front of the console because I have the main exhaust pointed at away from the wall to keep it running as smoothly as I can. It is louder than my TV volume. Some might say I should get an enclosed headset so I don't have to listen to the fan. My response to that is: A) there is not a quality wireless offering that I like. What happened to the small bluetooth earpiece for the 360 sold by Microsoft? not that it would even solve the problem and B) why should I have to be forced into purchasing something so I don't have to hear something I don't believe is a recognized problem. My problem is I hear the fan, then I hear the game. Looks like I may have to put the console into an entertainment stand that closes it off and hope it doesn't overheat. Or switch back to my Xbox One S, which is still silent...
Shipped from mallstop and it was a defective system that would turn itself off every time I tried to play a game. Was so disappointed I sent it back and switched to a ps4.
The most worthless thing I have ever purchased on amazon.....

I also wish they can make 4K/60fps for all games, but I believe these are coming in the near future.If you have the money, go for it !

I recently bought this device from a friend with the intent of only playing a few games once in a while when I was bored. Being new to the whole gaming world, I had no idea what this system was truly capable of. I was in for a big surprise! A great feature of this system is that you can download games, eliminating the clutter of disks. This is particularly handy as I am a college student and I move home every summer, so being able to pack up the system and go is a very nice addition.I was very pleased with the graphics and overall experience this system offered. It provides a realistic experience while playing which makes the games more desirable to play. Being a farm kid, the first game I downloaded was farming simulator. This probably is not the most popular game among XBOX players, but the clearness the system offered made it seem like I was actually on the farm!Along with the clarity and graphic display, I was pleasantly surprised at how many capabilities this system offered outside of game play. Outside of gameplay the Xbox One also functions as an entertainment system. You can surf the internet, watch different streaming services like Netflix and Hulu, and even connect your cable to watch TV through the system. This is nice because I can now watch programs on Netflix or Hulu without having to connect my laptop to my TV, losing access to doing work while watching shows. One of the biggest services I enjoy is being able to stream all of the ESPN channels through the Xbox and never miss a game. This is especially nice because often times the games I want to watch are not televised through my normal provider. There are also multiplayer capabilities, so now I can play Xbox with all my friends no matter where we are over the summer.I would definitely recommend this gaming system. Whether you are just starting out, or an experienced video game player this system offers a positive experience. The controls are simple enough for beginning players to understand and precise enough for advanced game play. If you are looking for a system that you can play once in a while and not be distracted, this is not the system for you. It will pull you in from the start and you will be hooked!

I've had this for 2 months now, and it crashes like no other.  Never had a gaming system this bad.  I've been on the phone with Amazon, Microsoft, and even people from Infiniti ward (call of duty), and no luck.  Seriously crashes ALL the time.  No its not my power cord, yes it's plugged direct into the wall.  I've reset it twice, and wiped multiple things on it back to factory settings.  Doesn't matter what game I'm playing.

The photos i included were direct screen shots on xbox and pulled off via drop box, hopefully amazon doesnt compress them because they are breathtaking, the two games that are used as examples are destiny 2 and Pubg. This console is very powerful. I would love to say this console is over price because when you could buy a slim for half the price, but the graphics snob inside myself tells me otherwise.  You are paying for the premium to play games at 60fps and at higher resolutions. In my opinion thats the same thing you do with buying computer hardware.

For some reason mine will only display in 1080p, not 4K, despite having the requisite hardware (Optoma UHD60 projector, Pioneer VSX-1131 receiver, and all brand new top of the line HDMI cables).  I have both an Xbox One S and PS4 Pro, both of which I have been using 4K HDR @ 60 Hz on for months.  I actually just removed the Xbox One S from my entertainment center and replaced it with the Xbox One X using all the same cables and everything.  I have tried every possible troubleshooting option from swapping to the supplied cables, factory resetting the console, updating firmware on TV and receiver, connecting power directly to the wall, and several other things MS tech support and I came up with, yet nothing.  The 4K TV Info in the Xbox settings menu even say that everything is compatible with 4K and I have hooked back up my Xbox One S and it still works in 4K like usual. At this point my only option per Microsoft is to drive all the way to a Microsoft store to swap it out (if they have one in stock) or mail it back for a new one in 2 weeks.  As an extremely loyal Xbox player I am VERY disappointed right now in both the console and lack of support.  Otherwise it plays in 1080p and the faster load time, smoother frame rates, and down sampled 4K all look amazing.  Will update this review if and when Microsoft makes this right.Edit: Well after several days and hours with tech support it randomly started working. Did not physically change a thing or alter any settings, it just started working and no one can make sense of it.  All told the system is awesome and just what I was hoping for. Wish more enhanced games were available at launch but patience is a virtue.

Everything messed up with the controller when I updated.== UPDATED ==  11-30-2017I spoke with Microsoft Xbox Support about my controller issue. They suggested to use a USB cable from your cell-phone to plug into the controller and the Xbox. Apparently, when the system downloads new patches, the controller also needs to be updated. The only way to update the controller is from a USB cable. As odd as that sounds, everything is working.

I'm NOT a gamer.  I purchased this as a replacement for my (INSANELY RELIABLE!!!!) PS3 for its 4K Ultra HD player, and a few games I wanted to start playing.  Here's what I can tell you.- Controller right out of the box would not connect to the console.  Because I'm new, it took me a bit to get through that.- Immediate software update required.  I'M OK with that, and expect those updates to fix issues that I had yet to see.- My first purchase through the Microsoft store locked up my brand new One X just hours out of the box.(AFTER the One X had already updated software)- Two weeks into owning this, I've had to Unplug power 4 times, and cycle power with the front button no less than 10 times. I've only downloaded Forza 7, and Minecraft for my son.  Switching between the games has become an issue as well as the games themselves having their own problems (see reviews of each game). - This morning, after One X was turned on and used for 15 minutes, I came back 2 hours later and neither controller could get the One X to turn back on (Pressing and holding the "X" button on the controller to turn the console on).  I pressed the power button on the console, and neither of my controllers would connect.  I went through all of the troubleshooting from my day one issue, and even a USB connection direct to the console wouldn't work.  AND again, had to actually unplug the console for a complete power cycle .... this making it the 4th time in two weeks.Disappointing that I purchased the biggest baddest ass console on the market, and I got a typical Microsoft product.  When it works, WOW it is freaking AWESOME.  But 5-10% of the time its one issue or another. Contemplating returning this for a PS4 with a a MUCH more stable operating system, and online store.

***EXTREMELY LONG RANT WARNING***First things first:  I am impressed by the AWESOME graphics of the console. Halo 5 without any updates runs and looks gaming PC good. I can't imagine how it will look with the enhancements update.OK, now I'll mention what outweighs the great graphics: my Xbox One X is SLUGISH, and is as BUGGY and UNRESPONSIVE as a Windows PC. Truly. It has that unfinished, beta version feel to it that Windows PCs exude. What do I mean? BUTTON PRESSES DO NOTHING, PAUSING DOWNLOADS DOES NOTHING, RESUMING DOWNLOADS ALSO DOES NOTHING. You can tell by the Caps-Lock that I am screaming. Seriously, nothing works right; everything does its own thing. I truly feel someone in a dark place somewhere is feeling overwhelming pleasure while I feel overwhelming frustration.Nothing I command the Xbox One X to do happens when I do it. I either have to wait for it or play catch-up with it. Press a button? PRESS IT AGAIN...because the first time it ignored me. PRESS A BUTTON...wait an interval of time until it finally does what it needs to do. What happened to press a button now and watch as what was supposed to happen happen right at that moment? It happens with most thing in life. It's the original design. I am so enraged, I am asking God to give me peace. This thing is INFURIATING.  I can return it, but I do not buy stuff to try and return. I buy stuff to keep. I am supposed to keep this and be happy with it, but no. I will probably have to waste my time to return it and ask Amazon for a refund. I hate wasting my time and Amazon's time. I'm sure someone that works for Amazon suffers every customer return.A Microsoft rep would probably generically respond: "That's not normal. Your console is probably defective. Please return it and get an exchange." NO! It is not defective. That's how it was defecated by Microsoft. That is what Microsoft put out as a finished product. I am an Army veteran, loyal to my government and my country. I am proud of my citizenship, and I am 100% pro USA everything, especially Made in USA. Why is this American-designed, Chinese-made console so horrible? It behaves just like most Windows PCs. Why does Microsoft taints hardware with their software? No matter who takes charge of the company, no matter who takes charge of whatever department, no matter what year, ANY SOFTWARE BY THEM IS HORRIBLE.What happens at that company? Why is the software bad no matter how many people that work there come and go? What exactly makes ANY operating system by Microsoft seem like it was sadistically designed by the devil's Psychological Torture Department? I am not being dramatic. I am just bursting at the seams from frustration. I love what the people at Microsoft are doing with the Xbox, and how they're proud of their work,  but I am enraged at the ghost behind the company. Been enduring its torture since the mid 90s.Even sadder, no matter how amazing the people who make the Xbox consoles are, no matter how visionary they are, no matter how in tune they are with gamers and their desires, it does not matter, because their hard work and time away from their families is stepped on by the ghost behind Microsoft: THE SOFTWARE BY MICROSOFT TAINTS ANYTHING IT TOUCHES.Why does my old PS4 work properly? Why does my new iPhone 8 Plus comply smoothly with my interactions with it? Why does my really old iMac behave like a new computer? Why does my old LG G3 obey me and responds as good as the iPhone? Hmmm, but why does my Xbox 360, which is more compliant than this rebellious Xbox One X that I bought to replace it, still enrages me with its unresponsiveness? Could it be Microsoft?"Coincidentally", I just built a high end GTX 1080-powered PC a month ago: it behaves as erratic and as frustrating as this Xbox One X. Seriously. No matter what updates I make to Windows 10, it has that same buggy, non-compliant spirit that is in the Xbox One X. There is no difference between Windows 10 and using the Xbox One X.Microsoft software taints everything it touches. I use my iPhone and the software melts with the hardware. It's a seamless, smooth experience. It makes me smile. Same with the old PS4. There is no separation. Everything flows. Not with my Xbox One X. It feels like the software can't keep up with the hardware. It's not a transparent interaction. I can feel the buggy software try to puppet the great hardware.Why? WHY? Why can't Microsoft make good stuff like everyone else? Last night I went to Wxxmxrt and got Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection for the PS4. Isn't that sad? Isn't it pathetic that I have to buy old remastered PS3 games to soothe my disappointment at Microsoft? I know life goes on, but it speaks volumes when an older, inferior console is here to cool down my anger. I'm having an AWESOME time with my old PS4 and old games. It scratches the itch that the Xbox One X was supposed to scratch. It is fair to feel angered and disappointed when you feel like a company duped you. Yeah. I have a brand new Xbox One X yet I get angry just seeing its face, because I KNOW it will enrage me as soon as I press a button and it just does its little "you pressed me" animation and nothing else. Or the screen goes black and the system restarts. Or I try to open ANY app and it just spins and spins and NOTHING ELSE. Why are the apps there then if they don't open?I almost want to say its stupid face, because it has angered me so much, I detest it like if it was a living being. It's been three days of misery. I paid $500 to feel so langered? I want to curse and break things. I didn't even know I could get this angry and thirsty for vengeance! I feel appeased when returning to my old PS4 to play remastered PS3 games. Dude, dudette, bro, sis...man...yo...I AM SO ENRAGED, I SOMETIMES FEEL LIKE CRYING, and I am a GROWN MAN close to his 40s. Can you believe that?  The Xbox One X makes me remember my young days raging at stuff, only now I have to BOTTLE THIS ANGER AND NOT CURSE OR BREAK ANYTHING because it doesn't profit or fix anything. That's why I FEEL SO DESPERATELY UNAVENGED, MICROSOFT.  May God have mercy on you...whoever is responsible for releasing the Xbox One X in this lousy state!!!Why did I write this? Not to be hostile towards Microsoft, because good people work there, but to WARN YOU that the corporate spirit of Microsoft tainted the Xbox One X you're thinking of buying. Its power is held back by beta version-feeling software. It all looks and feels cheap interface-wise. Even the console and the controller, while having perfect fit and finish, was made with cheap-looking/feeling plastic. It feels very toy-like and un-premium like generic Chinese-made stuff. It's two steps back behind the older Xbox One and Xbox 360 consoles that felt way better. I tried to be as long-winded as possible. Thanks for reading and may God bless you! Sorry if this seemed negative. I'm just telling you my bad experience. I'm looking for reasons not to return it but I can't find any. It's either its bugginess or lack of good games. Yesterday I got Battlefront 2 and Gears of Wars 4 and I have not opened them yet due to poor reviews. Graphics are not enough. Take care. Peace!

I don't have an XBox 1 X.  I have the S.  I just have a niggle.  I know games are much more mainstream and thus, more profitable, as well as vastly larger than they used to be.  The resolution is incredible, compared to the Atari 2600 that I had briefly before my dad returned it when I was a kid.  That said, why does one need to have an internet connection to enjoy these games?  I pay $50 for a brand new game and yet, I have to be paying a monthly bill because the games do not work without downloading themselves, and THEN updating the xbox.  I got the 500 GB S, and when I downloaded all 5 games I had to begin with, I ran out of space to download the other Halo game that came with it.  I knew the entirely downloaded games would take up some space, but damn.  Also, they bill it as a "500 GB" hard drive.  320 is usable.  So it doesn't matter that my hard drive is 500 GB.  Ok, but the XBox One is a marvel.  I love it.  The software available is excellent, and Microsoft even offers free downloads of games (albeit they want you to by it eventually) through the ms marketplace.  I wouldn't trade my xbox for all the playstations in the world.

Got this bad boy delivered right on time, Launch day. Because of my work schedule & family life stuff didn't get around to hooking it up to play for about a week.  Technically 5 days, but whatever.  So anyway, 2 days ago hooked everything up very easy & nice because there is no longer a giant power brick that this has to plug into. Goes straight into the wall, with a built-in surge protector. Nice! Moving on. Got thru setup & all that jazz. Very easy, it found my 4k tv , sets it's own resolution, very snazzy. Decided I wanted to play the new Call of Duty which I had been waiting to play since it was released. Then the usual install of disc. Bummer. As soon as it finished the game install, nothing but problems. It did a restart. Came back onto the green Xbox screen. Moment later a black screen with nothing else on it. So, I googled it. Found instructions to do a reset, hold the power button for 10 sec & it restarts. Same problem. Called Microsoft. Went thru factory reset. As soon as I went back thru the setup, same issue immediately happens. Ok, so Pam with Microsoft says I need to send you out a new replacement. Of course they have to place another $540.17 hold on my card to do so. Ok, fine. She runs my card, says it's declined. That's odd, tried 3 more times. Still declined. While I'm on the phone with her I get an email & txt from my bank showing the charges go thru.  Well, dang! She comes back on the line, and apologizes. She's having some sort of computer issue. Sees that my card has been charged 3x but cannot send out a replacement. Tells me not to fear, the charges should be returned within 15 DAYS!!!!!!! Now here I sit - no Xbox, bank issues because of Microsoft & now no word on when a replacement maybe made available thru Amazon.Hopefully if anyone bought this thing for their kids, they make sure it works before Christmas morning.

So I bought an XBOX from Best Buy a few months ago and honestly not it‚Äôs not bad but you‚Äôre really better off spending a tad more for a PC that can do 60FPS even if its @ 1080p.1080p @ 60FPS is MUCH MUCH better than 4K @ 30FPS. Nice visuals are a bunus sure but at 30FPS everything looks like a blur regardless unless you‚Äôre eithet standing still or moving really really slow...Seriously, if you aren‚Äôt very familiar with gaming just ask anybody who knows anything about gaming and they will tell you the same: 1080p / 60FPS > 4K / 30FPS.So the XBOX may be able to produce visuals approaching something like a GTX 1070 but due to its CPU being very weak (They had to cut cost somewhere afterall to sell it for just $499) it is not capable of delivering 60FPS gameplay in demanding AAA titles like Destiny 2 for example.The CPU in the XBOX X is barely anymore powerful than the CPU in the PS4 Pro so you will be stuck with a machine that kinda / sorta does 4K but at a rather abyssal 30FPS...With just a bit more money you could either purchase new or build your own PC that will run any AAA at 60FPS.The performance of the system represented by the FPS (frames per second) is MUCH more important and is what makes games truely enjoyable to play.Nice visuals of course are nice but again if your stuck at 30FPS (due to the weak CPU in your XBOX X / PS4 Pro) everything is a BLUR anyway once you start moving around.Seriously, do yourself a favor a save up ar

Received this supposedly new xbox one x. The system had previously been used with the last users accounts and games still on the machine. The machine froze and black screened constantly and finally would not launch at all. Luckily for no apparent action on my part a screen came up offering the troubleshooter and I reset the whole thing wiping everything and restoring factory defaults. 3 times the system hung and I couldn't even turn it off. I finally unplugged it for a minute, restarted and once again tried restoring the system to factory. It finally worked but now I have to start reinstalling the games. This machine should never had been resold and my trust in amazon just did a nose dive.Update: The machine stopped running again. Black screen, locking up, shutting off by itself. Amazon should be totally ashamed to do business this way. This was received as a gift and the person who bought it is furious with amazon. If re-boxing bad merchandise and sending it out to loyal paying customers then perhaps this place doesn't need our business. No apologies offered, just "send it back". Because of their careless practices we have to return this useless paper weight. Thanks amazon, for nothing. Cancelling prime membership as well. Not paying these jerks another dime.Update 2: Have returned this used, broken system (sold as new) for a refund. Extremely disappointed in Amazon. No apologies offered. This is disgusting.

This is an initial review, based on set up and a couple of hours of play. I will update the review as my experience deepens.  The following compares the X to the 360 it replaces.  Set up was easier, w/ less wire (power cord is just a straight cord into the machine - no transformer) and a smaller box.  Controller is smaller and feels slightly more finicky in my hand (small, less ergonomic).  Performance, based on the two games I could download for free, was meh - no noticeable increase in speed or graphics quality (1080P TV display).  I was initially disappointed, mistakenly thinking that either it came w/ Kinect or Kinect was built in; neither is the case.  I am disappointed that not only do you have to buy another Kinect (all 360 peripherals are now worthless) at $100, you have to ALSO buy a cable adapter to connect it to the X for another $40.  Having already spent $500 on the console and $60 for a second controller, this extra $100 then yet another $40 feels like a rip-off.  In summary, I don't feel any better off than I was when I was $600 richer.  I regret the purchase.

Update: I'm on my third Xbox One X!I received my second Xbox One X on November 24th. So, the first console worked for a couple days, the second one lasted two months. Now I am on to my third purchase of the identical product in the span of a couple months. It worked fine up until today in which it turned off indiscriminately precisely the same way the first one did. This time I made sure to never plug it into a surge protector and connected it directly into the wall and it still petered out in a disgracefully short period of time. Thus, the probability that the third one will work is unlikely, in which case I will just give up and take the refund--this nonsense just isn't worth it. This is a repeat of my experience with the Xbox 360, but at least that had good exclusive games, unlike this successor.The Xbox One X just doesn't have any exclusive games worth playing. The few that they tout, such as the overly praised and abysmal looking, controlling, and atrociously unplayable PUBG, you can play on a computer--and it functions infinitely better on it as well. Just look up Player Unknown Battlegrounds (PUBG), this game could have easily been made on the 360. Isn't the main selling point of the Xbox One X that "It is the most powerful console on the planet by 40%?" Well, what's the point if you have games like PUBG that look like they were made well over a decade ago?With the first defective unit, I will be liberal and say that it functioned for approximately ten hours. The last time it I was using the product, it made an obnoxiously loud beeping noise while the power indicator kept on flickering incessantly--it eventually shut off. Before all this had happened, I had bought several games for this brand-new console presuming that it would actually function. Given that, I transferred everything over to this new system from my original Xbox One. I therefore traded in the old version for a measly $60 credit, because the Xbox One X is backwards compatible making the original obsolete. If I hadn't done that, at least I could have gone back to the old system. Maybe I have too high of standards, but I just have an expectation that when I buy a new product, it should actually work.The very little time that the machine was somewhat usable said a lot about the storage capacity of the unit as well. As soon as you connect the console to the internet, you are asked to apply the newest update. After having done this, you are left with 780.6 GB of free hard drive out of the relatively meager 1 terabyte disk space. Another staggering fact is that Gears of War 4 (the disc version) requires 103.3 GB of data. You don't need to be a calculus professor to know that you are going to run out of space at an alarmingly fast rate. To Microsoft's credit, however, you are thankfully able to use external hard drives.I spent almost four hours in the span of less than a day speaking with Microsoft employees. I had to talk to a total of fifteen "service" members. That alone is appalling, but it gets much worse. Three of those individuals were actually respectful human beings, the rest were ignorant, rude or both simultaneously. Why would you have to repeat the same story about a defective system twice, much less fifteen times? What is the point of a reference number, if they don't record the information from the consumer anyway? After all that time, the best Microsoft could do, an international conglomerate, was to send me a code for three months "free" of Xbox Live! I, at best, lost the call from the thirteenth person I talked to who was a supervisor. Now he, along with the four other people that preceded him, transferred me to this charlatan in which I had to repeat the story ad nauseum and give my phone number in case the call was dropped. I'd like to give this so-called manager the benefit of the doubt, but in light of the evidence I have touched upon I find it highly unlikely that he didn't hang up on me. But even if that wasn't true, he should have called back if the call was dropped--he didn't.The Xbox One X has no games specifically designed for the new hardware. I'm well aware that there are some games new and old that are taking advantage of some of the new capabilities, namely Gears of War 4, Forza Motorsport 7 or the new multi-platform games of Call of Duty: WW II, and Assassin's Creed: Origins. But is having higher resolution, or taking off a few seconds of loading time worth, at a bare minimum, $500, with a difference that many people can't even discern? Clearly no. I have been buying consoles for twenty-two years, and I have never received a defective unit from Nintendo, Sony, Sega, etcetera. Now good-old Microsoft has produced four dysfunctional systems for me. The widely publicized and nearly ubiquitous problem of the aptly titled "red ring of death" necessitated that I had to purchase three Xbox 360's before I received one that actually worked. Now to that proud heritage they can add that their newest console also didn't function. Further, the last two employees I talked to at Microsoft excoriated me for plugging my system into a surge protector. Supposedly you are to directly connect the system to your power outlet. Even if this is the case, which negates the whole function of surge protector, the company should specifically address this issue in the direction manual, but of course they do not.I have some other fun facts to think about before considering buying this, as it currently stands, abysmal machine. Again, there is currently no games designed for the hardware. I am unaware of a console ever being released where this is the case. The controller still uses double AA batteries. To give you a point of contact, Microsoft's competitors in Playstation and Nintendo both have rechargeable controllers, and they have had them for their last two consoles. The cherry on top is that the rechargeable battery pack I bought for the controller shuts off intermittently as well. So I have to return that as well.If I have convinced a single person not to buy this product I will feel like I have accomplished something. It was completely ignorant of me to buy this machine, but I always like to buy new consoles. And given that I just bought a brand-new 4K television, with 2160p resolution, and which is also HDR compatible, I thought it would be nice to have console that has the capabilities to showcase those new technological breakthroughs.The next problem with Microsoft is they just released a new console last year in the Xbox One S. The X is the third iteration with different hardware specification in the same generation. Again, this is unprecedented. Thus, it is quite likely that they will make another product before the next generation of consoles. I wouldn't be the least bit surprised with the impending release of an Xbox One Y by the end of this year.Some other factors I hope other consumers will reflect upon. The president of the Xbox division Phil Spencer spoke extensively that the Kinect was an integral part of the Xbox One experience--that is why it was originally packaged with it. Well, if that is, or was true, why do you have to spend an additional $40 dollars to even utilize it? (By the way, Microsoft no longer makes the Kinect, nor the adapter that you need to use it on your Xbox One S or the Xbox One X). So here is the mathematics: The Xbox One X costs $499.99. To fully take advantage of its capabilities, you have to spend $25 dollars for a rechargeable battery. You also must waste another $25 dollars to be able to use your controller wirelessly through your computer, which they tout as a great new feature being able to play (some) games on your computer as well when you purchase a game on Xbox One. Now don't be fooled by Microsoft with their ridiculous propaganda of the "Play Anywhere" campaign. This silly idea that if you buy a game for Xbox, you can play it on your personal computer as well. That is technically true, but only for a grand total of twenty-two games, which is clearly pathetic. To their credit, the single exceedingly exceptional exclusive in Cuphead is one of those very select games.It shows how credulous some gamers are that they have such an affinity for brand names that this product has over a four and a half star rating out of five and it has hardly been out for a month--with no games that actually are designed for the system. And what's worse, the Xbox One barely has any exclusive titles. According to Metacritic, which simply compiles every review for a game into a single aggregate score, there is only two Xbox One exclusive titles that make the list of their top twenty-five games for the system since it was originally released on November 22nd, 2013: Forza Horizon 3 at number seven, and Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition at sixteen.If you look at all the one-star reviews, they all say the same thing that I have said: the product isn't even functioning. Please do not buy into this scam. If you do, be prepared that the machine may not work, and if that is the case good luck getting help from Microsoft. I have never in my life had worse customer "service" from any other company on the planet.

I currently own all three iterations of the Xbox one. I asked for this as one of my Christmas gifts, and I was actually counting the days. After a long day of festivities, I race home to try out my new toy, as my son plays with his new toys.I open the gift wrap to see a relatively plain box. Nothing special, oh well, box is going in the attic anyways. Plug it in, and YAY, even with all the extra power, no extra brick! The One X is ugly. Yep, I understand minimalism. I have various Apple devices that are minimalistic, and yet they ooze sexy. Design team should be punched in the throat.System starts up with no growl or screeching tire sounds. One little splash screen is the only thing that even denotes this system is any different than the original. Nothing is faster at this point, but that‚Äôs probably more due to Microsoft‚Äôs janky interface.Game is now running, and once again, I cannot see any difference. My television is a Samsung UHD 60‚Äù curved 4K. I‚Äôm not an expert by any means, but I should notice some difference on a 40% faster system. 20+ games, and almost two months later, and I cannot notice a difference between my slim and this one.I cannot in good faith recommend this to anyone, at this point. 540 after tax, 25 for controller charger, 59 for game, 60 for Xbox live. Almost 700 bucks to only play one game if you are just starting out.I wanted to love this system. I wanted to go to work and tell my buddies how my system could eat their PS4s. Instead, I feel duped. The One X is like having a Lamborghini, but only being able to drive it in the city. I really hope Microsoft steps it up, and someone utilizes this power to justify the cost. Until that time, I would wait for a good bundle deal or a price cut.

Games would freeze, or crash, games wouldn't download at all (with my 150mb Internet) etc. The system would not shut down, even after sitting for 5 MINUTES (literally)....I had to shut it off by hand. Would give 0 Stars if possible. Console gaming is dying due to constant implementation of loot boxes and micro transactions. Gone are the days of paying $60 for a premium game and having to pay a little extra for added content down the line like maps for Battlefield 1. Now every game has features you need to pay extra for. Worst is a lot of these are like gambling cuz you never know what your getting. What's worse then that is that sometimes you get duplicate items. Why must the console gaming industry go the way of the smart phone freemium industry? Greed......... If this is the case there is no need to spend this much on a console that is only gonna have games that will want full price with micro transactions through out every other game coming out. Save your money till this gets legislated or the console gaming industry decides its not in the freemium gaming industry.  Thill then its just not worth the asking price to be nickle and dimed trying to enjoy a game I just spent $60 on.

I got this hoping it would be a significant upgrade from the Xbox One. Boy was I wrong. I will say that it is all around better than the Xbox One, but the improvements are pretty minor. The 'Enhanced' titles aren't even noticeably enhanced. I even found some regular titles looked better than the enhanced ones. GTA V and Forza Horizon 3 are the best looking games out of the 20 or so major games I have, and neither of them are enhanced. So all in all, graphical improvements are minor and enhanced titles are pretty much a joke.Performance wise, it's pretty good. Games load much faster and there is no lag on anything. Framerates fluctuate between 30-50 FPS based off of what I've seen.If you do not already have a console, this is a pretty good purchase if you aren't afraid to blow all your money. If you already have an Xbox One or Xbox One S, do NOT buy this unless you are willing to drop $500 on minor improvements.

Now being stuck in for extended periods of time I decided to buy an Xbox and can't say that I'm disappointed! Great fun and using the game pass means you've got access to thousands of games for a cheap monthly subscription. Fabulous quality item which arrived very quickly. Great boredom breaker.

Arrived in original box with seals unbroken. Upgraded from my original xbox one to the X and was blown away by the difference in both graphics and performance. I have gone from having lacklustre connection in multiplayer to ridiculous levels of connection speed. I was getting anywhere from 15mbps-80mbps with the original xbox one. Now with the X I'm getting upwards of 215mbps, I hit 405mbps last night. The improvement in graphic capability is significant too, seeing things in modern warfare that were not there with the one. Textures and small hairline cracks in walls to name just one. Things look like you could just grab them off the screen. Is it with buying in 2020, absolutely in my opinion. The series X will be expensive at launch, and games will take a while to fully utilise the new tech in the series X. Also the X is super quiet when running, even when loading a disc up.

Bought this as an upgrade from the original Xbox One so I could start gaming in 4K. I do not regret it, it's a fantastic console. Much faster than the original, allows quicker transitions across the Xbox interface and greatly improves the graphics of games as well. Apart from a slightly louder whirring sound when it runs demanding games, it's generally very quiet. Would recommend it if you want to upgrade from an older version or if you don't want an Xbox Series X yet.

Shortly after the Amazon return window's closed, console stopped booting. Sent to Microsoft for repair, expecting a refurbished one back. It appears to be that:1. Amazon won't accept it back after just one month from the purchase2. Microsoft provides only 1 yr of manufacturer warranty in Canada3. It's worth registering the device at support.microsoft.com right after the purchase and check warranty expiration dates, etc.4. Google "xbox one x E105 E102 boot problem" before buying it. Had my warranty expiring in just 5 months from purchase, MS service reset it to correct dates.

I have had my xbox one x for a couple of weeks  now and have a game pass subscription. Firstly let me say that game pass is a must have, plenty of quality games that you can download whenever you want. Secondly I am amazed at how quiet the console is as compared with my old PS4 pro. Thirdly the games on the one x are jaw dropping specially the enhanced games but all of the games I have installed both from game pass and the microsoft store and both enhanced and standard all look fantastic even old 360 classics looks amazing. Multiplat games like crash n sane trilogy and spyro trilogy and the bioshock collection as examples look miles better than either the PS4 Pro or Switch. Caution, you will need an additional external hardrive I would recommend a 4tb at least as once you start browsing the game pass and microsoft games catalogue you will be downloading games none stop. Overall the xbox one x is a fantastic piece of kit all games look amazing on it (provided you have a 4k tv). Highly recommended..

i was very happy when i recieved this, boxed up, new packaging, 380 pound brand new.....so i thought.....it was perfectly fine for the 1st 3 days, but then started to crash on every single game i played, the issue was caused by overheating, i took it to get repaired and he told me the problem was it had no thermal paste whatsoever on the cpu and the copper strips on the motherboard had been worn down. i was completely shocked!!!he told me it was a used console, which was disappointing because i spent alot of money on something that i thought was brand new and costing me extra to get it repaired, new copper strips and new thermal paste, he said that i was lucky that the cpu itself didnt catch fire, and i couldnt sent it back because after being opened it voids the warranty.i recommend amazon to test and check there consoles inside and out in the near future, please make sure that it is brand new, and not used....and that there is fresh thermal paste on the CPU and make sure the consoles components are 100% working and in perfect condition before shipping

Fantastic console.  Xbox One Enhanced games look incredible on a 4K HDR screen.  Old games get a performance boost; faster loading, higher frame rates, better texture filtering and even a resolution bump on some titles.  Enhanced games still looks great on 1080p screens.  The console down samples the higher native resolution which results in a clean, smooth and detailed image.  A huge upgrade in visual quality compared to the standard Xbox One.  This is the console to own if you want the best looking, best performing third party titles.The unit is good looking, and extremely quiet. No Kinect include.  I appreciate the built in power bar as it really cleans up the wires behind your entertainment center.  XB1X has a 1TB HDD, which is nice, however some X Enhanced titles can be 100GB or more in size.  An external HDD is something to consider down the road.
